commit_message:
Add bind mount of /opt/cache/files to all containers in CI

This is needed so that the task which downloads the cirros
image in the utility container for LXC jobs will find the
cached image in /opt/cache/files.

Change-Id: If4402ef877f8b627237b6e9016089c134be72da5

subject: Reduce fact gathering
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-22 20:47:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-02-23 07:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-23 14:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-22 20:47:58.000000000', 'message': "Reduce fact gathering

We've seen that large amount of facts for hosts have a direct impact on
task execution as part of the deployment.  This change reduces the
amount of data that we are collecting when we use facts and leverages
more targeted methods to collect the required information.

Change-Id: I49e6ca02c2b4791641fb27ebf258ef6c9d52dd9e
Related-Bug: #1915761
(cherry picked from commit f6c0acc7fe7e4571fc923d85422d7781b6d35151)
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce fact gathering

We've seen that large amount of facts for hosts have a direct impact on
task execution as part of the deployment.  This change reduces the
amount of data that we are collecting when we use facts and leverages
more targeted methods to collect the required information.

Change-Id: I49e6ca02c2b4791641fb27ebf258ef6c9d52dd9e
Related-Bug: #1915761
(cherry picked from commit f6c0acc7fe7e4571fc923d85422d7781b6d35151)

commit_message:
Add SITE_PACKAGES variable to horizon extend_start

This change adds a missing export. Without this change the horizon
dashboards are all broken becuase the functions are able to
correctly copy the dashboards plugins to the appropriate locations.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5fa3bb41403620e8bd9521e3c0e61570e202148f
(cherry picked from commit 8daeeef06733500efff45faf8f6a44ba0e48ecad)

[{'created': '2021-02-09 21:47:33.000000000', 'message': "[DNM] [OVN] security group logging support

Do not merge: as OVN driver security-group-logging is a new
feature, it will not be backported to stable braches. This
gerrit is mostly a placeholder, to be soon abandoned.

This is a small subset of patchset 2 of 3 for OVN driver handling
of security-group-logging. It is mostly part of the networking-ovn
repo for stable/train.

This implementation also changes the minimum allowed value for the
'rate_limit' attribute in neutron/conf/services/logging.py
Originally, the 'rate_limit' had a min value of 100 and it is now 1
packet per second. The default value remains unchanged, as 100.

commit_message:
[DNM] [OVN] security group logging support

Do not merge: as OVN driver security-group-logging is a new
feature, it will not be backported to stable branches. This
gerrit is mostly a placeholder, to be soon abandoned.

This is a small subset of patchset 2 of 3 for OVN driver handling
of security-group-logging. It is mostly part of the networking-ovn
repo for stable/train.

This implementation also changes the minimum allowed value for the
'rate_limit' attribute in neutron/conf/services/logging.py
Originally, the 'rate_limit' had a min value of 100 and it is now 1
packet per second. The default value remains unchanged, as 100.

Related-Bug: 1914757
Related-Bug: 1468366

Change-Id: I235c3ce5d99431e5c61988b3c925d4548454444e
(cherry picked from commit 5b69930792cfb39143e672cda97bea077f69abc0)

commit_message:
[DNM] [OVN] security group logging support

Do not merge: as OVN driver security-group-logging is a new
feature, it will not be backported to stable branches. This
gerrit is mostly a placeholder, to be soon abandoned.

This is patchset 3 of 3 for OVN driver handling of security-group-logging.
It includes tests added to validate this feature.

Closes-Bug: 1914757

Change-Id: I0589beb4b2d8efcea863617f458019faffe359e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 14:02:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix broken configdrive_use_object_store

When it is set to True, we try to write text data to a binary file,
which is not possible in Python 3. The issue has been "helpfully"
hidden by the fact that we use bytes in unit tests, as well as
by lack of CI coverage.

Change-Id: Ibbf90dcbcb36a5f7cf084a44a221c0c5c003b95a
(cherry picked from commit 73bdebd127b3897860c7bcff3848032a2737d1ba)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken configdrive_use_object_store

When it is set to True, we try to write text data to a binary file,
which is not possible in Python 3. The issue has been "helpfully"
hidden by the fact that we use bytes in unit tests, as well as
by lack of CI coverage.

Change-Id: Ibbf90dcbcb36a5f7cf084a44a221c0c5c003b95a
(cherry picked from commit 73bdebd127b3897860c7bcff3848032a2737d1ba)

commit_message:
Filter out direct_url from image properties

The direct_url property is set by glance-api and it is not allowed
to update the parameter from client side. This change ensures that
the property is filtered out.

Note that this property is visible only when show_image_direct_url is
True, thus the problem has not been detected in the current acceptance
test which use show_image_direct_url=False.

Change-Id: Ief5cf6c6e4767516ff152f9ee5487fc52854e298

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-31 14:33:23.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add a routed networks scheduler pre-filter

As explained in the spec, in order to support routed networks, we need
to add a new new scheduler pre-filter with a specific conf option
so we can then look at the nova aggregates related to the segments.

Since this pre-filter is called every time we verify the scheduler,
that means that when we move instances, we should be also be able
to only support hosts that are in the same related aggregate.

TODO:
* test coverage both unit and functional
* documentation
* finish the func test

Implements: blueprint routed-networks-scheduling

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@est.tech>

Change-Id: I667f56612d7f63834863476694cb1f4c71a58302

As explained in the spec, in order to support routed networks, we need
to add a new new scheduler pre-filter with a specific conf option
so we can then look at the nova aggregates related to the segments.

Since this pre-filter is called every time we verify the scheduler,
that means that when we move instances, we should be also be able
to only support hosts that are in the same related aggregate.

NOTE(sbauza): We had to change the _unshelve_server method in the
integrated tests to provide a null value instead of an empty dict
because of 2.77 API microversion that now doesn't accept empty
dicts.

commit_message:
Add a routed networks scheduler pre-filter

As explained in the spec, in order to support routed networks, we need
to add a new scheduler pre-filter with a specific conf option
so we can then look at the nova aggregates related to the segments.

Since this pre-filter is called every time we verify the scheduler,
that means that when we move instances, we should be also be able
to only support hosts that are in the same related aggregate.

NOTE(sbauza) : We're just setting admin_api variable in the
integrated helpers as it's used by _get_provider_uuid_by_host()

Implements: blueprint routed-networks-scheduling

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@est.tech>

Change-Id: I667f56612d7f63834863476694cb1f4c71a58302

subject: Populate shrinking shards with shard ranges learnt from root
messages: [{'account_id': 597, 'date': '2021-02-23 00:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-02-23 05:52:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nClean cherry-pick; has ample test coverage. The new state gives me pause, but it's the same upgrade story we've always offered."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 00:47:18.000000000', 'message': "Populate shrinking shards with shard ranges learnt from root

Shard shrinking can be instigated by a third party modifying shard
ranges, moving one shard to shrinking state and expanding the
namespace of one or more other shard(s) to act as acceptors. These
state and namespace changes must propagate to the shrinking and
acceptor shards. The shrinking shard must also discover the acceptor
shard(s) into which it will shard itself.

The sharder audit function already updates shards with their own state
and namespace changes from the root. However, there is currently no
mechanism for the shrinking shard to learn about the acceptor(s) other
than by a PUT request being made to the shrinking shard container.

This patch modifies the shard container audit function so that other
overlapping shards discovered from the root are merged into the
audited shard's db. In this way, the audited shard will have acceptor
shards to cleave to if shrinking.

This new behavior is restricted to when the shard is shrinking. In
general, a shard is responsible for processing its own sub-shard
ranges (if any) and reporting them to root. Replicas of a shard
container synchronise their sub-shard ranges via replication, and do
not rely on the root to propagate sub-shard ranges between shard
replicas. The exception to this is when a third party (or
auto-sharding) wishes to instigate shrinking by modifying the shard
and other acceptor shards in the root container.  In other
circumstances, merging overlapping shard ranges discovered from the
root is undesirable because it risks shards inheriting other unrelated
shard ranges. For example, if the root has become polluted by
split-brain shard range management, a sharding shard may have its
sub-shards polluted by an undesired shard from the root.

During the shrinking process a shard range's own shard range state may
be either shrinking or, prior to this patch, sharded. The sharded
state could occur when one replica of a shrinking shard completed
shrinking and moved the own shard range state to sharded before other
replica(s) had completed shrinking. This makes it impossible to
distinguish a shrinking shard (with sharded state), which we do want
to inherit shard ranges, from a sharding shard (with sharded state),
which we do not want to inherit shard ranges.

This patch therefore introduces a new shard range state, 'SHRUNK', and
applies this state to shard ranges that have completed shrinking.
Shards are now restricted to inherit shard ranges from the root only
when their own shard range state is either SHRINKING or SHRUNK.

This patch also:

 - Stops overlapping shrinking shards from generating audit warnings:
   overlaps are cured by shrinking and we therefore expect shrinking
   shards to sometimes overlap.

 - Extends an existing probe test to verify that overlapping shard
   ranges may be resolved by shrinking a subset of the shard ranges.

 - Adds a --no-auto-shard option to swift-container-sharder to enable the
   probe tests to disable auto-sharding.

 - Improves sharder logging, in particular by decrementing ranges_todo
   when a shrinking shard is skipped during cleaving.

 - Adds a ShardRange.sort_key class method to provide a single definition
   of ShardRange sort ordering.

 - Improves unit test coverage for sharder shard auditing.

Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Cherry-Picked-From: I9034a5715406b310c7282f1bec9625fe7acd57b6
Change-Id: I6543bfff5ca517ab4d6ffda881e3a50724078c65
"}]
commit_message:
Populate shrinking shards with shard ranges learnt from root

Shard shrinking can be instigated by a third party modifying shard
ranges, moving one shard to shrinking state and expanding the
namespace of one or more other shard(s) to act as acceptors. These
state and namespace changes must propagate to the shrinking and
acceptor shards. The shrinking shard must also discover the acceptor
shard(s) into which it will shard itself.

The sharder audit function already updates shards with their own state
and namespace changes from the root. However, there is currently no
mechanism for the shrinking shard to learn about the acceptor(s) other
than by a PUT request being made to the shrinking shard container.

This patch modifies the shard container audit function so that other
overlapping shards discovered from the root are merged into the
audited shard's db. In this way, the audited shard will have acceptor
shards to cleave to if shrinking.

This new behavior is restricted to when the shard is shrinking. In
general, a shard is responsible for processing its own sub-shard
ranges (if any) and reporting them to root. Replicas of a shard
container synchronise their sub-shard ranges via replication, and do
not rely on the root to propagate sub-shard ranges between shard
replicas. The exception to this is when a third party (or
auto-sharding) wishes to instigate shrinking by modifying the shard
and other acceptor shards in the root container.  In other
circumstances, merging overlapping shard ranges discovered from the
root is undesirable because it risks shards inheriting other unrelated
shard ranges. For example, if the root has become polluted by
split-brain shard range management, a sharding shard may have its
sub-shards polluted by an undesired shard from the root.

During the shrinking process a shard range's own shard range state may
be either shrinking or, prior to this patch, sharded. The sharded
state could occur when one replica of a shrinking shard completed
shrinking and moved the own shard range state to sharded before other
replica(s) had completed shrinking. This makes it impossible to
distinguish a shrinking shard (with sharded state), which we do want
to inherit shard ranges, from a sharding shard (with sharded state),
which we do not want to inherit shard ranges.

This patch therefore introduces a new shard range state, 'SHRUNK', and
applies this state to shard ranges that have completed shrinking.
Shards are now restricted to inherit shard ranges from the root only
when their own shard range state is either SHRINKING or SHRUNK.

This patch also:

 - Stops overlapping shrinking shards from generating audit warnings:
   overlaps are cured by shrinking and we therefore expect shrinking
   shards to sometimes overlap.

 - Extends an existing probe test to verify that overlapping shard
   ranges may be resolved by shrinking a subset of the shard ranges.

 - Adds a --no-auto-shard option to swift-container-sharder to enable the
   probe tests to disable auto-sharding.

 - Improves sharder logging, in particular by decrementing ranges_todo
   when a shrinking shard is skipped during cleaving.

 - Adds a ShardRange.sort_key class method to provide a single definition
   of ShardRange sort ordering.

 - Improves unit test coverage for sharder shard auditing.

Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Cherry-Picked-From: I9034a5715406b310c7282f1bec9625fe7acd57b6
Change-Id: I6543bfff5ca517ab4d6ffda881e3a50724078c65

messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-02-23 00:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2021-02-23 01:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

ouch :('}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2021-02-23 01:49:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

mind adding a comment in global-reqs so it's not removed?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-02-23 05:41:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-02-23 05:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Good idea; done.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2021-02-23 05:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

lgtm, thanks'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-02-23 11:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Is there a reason py2-specific requirements are not being tracked locally in python-swiftclient like they are in swift itself? Upstream has dropped py2, so I think that is the more correct way to address this.

That said, meh.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-02-23 18:39:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Is there a reason py2-specific requirements are not being tracked locally in python-swiftclient like they are in swift itself? Upstream has dropped py2, so I think that is the more correct way to address this.

Swift itself has no py2-specific dependencies. Or rather, the py2-specific dependencies is has also get pulled in as transitive deps via eventlet and cryptography; see https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/src/tag/2.26.0/requirements.txt#L16-L23

It *does* have a py2-specific constraints file, but that isn't enough to avoid a requirements-check failure like

 ERROR: Requirement '{Requirement(package='futures', location='', specifiers='>=3.0.0', markers="python_version=='2.7'", comment='# BSD', extras=frozenset())}' not in openstack/requirements

at https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/9115284ec9e547b5b27d4cca4db97795/log/job-output.txt#1009. Maybe we could update the requirements-check job to (optionally?) ignore any py2-specific requirements found?'}]

[{'created': '2021-02-23 00:05:06.000000000', 'message': "Bring back futures for py27 (again)

It's the one py2-specific dependency that python-swiftclient needs; keep
it around so the Swift team can still modify their requirements files.

commit_message:
Bring back futures for py27 (again)

It's the one py2-specific dependency that python-swiftclient needs; keep
it around so the Swift team can still modify their requirements files.

Change-Id: Icb055e7a9d48e1e48126ef2692f796c4dc11f8b1
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/776998
Related-Change: I1bc1fe988e3cfd4824dd7b4a9327a67db46c1533
Related-Change: I704979556369dc244da51608a13abc5a06a29912

commit_message:
Refactor audit shard tests

The existing tests cover a lot of behaviors and carry around a lot of
state that makes them hard to extend in a descriptive mannor to cover
new or changed behaviors.

Change-Id: Ic39cf0cf193e45a0969700fdbca234a73afe579c

commit_message:
Don't configure dnsmasq entries for "network" ports

Ports with device_owner like:
* floating_ip,
* DHCP,
* some types of router ports, like: HA interface interface,
* distributed ports,
don't need to be configured in the dnsmasq file.
So there is no need to reload dnsmasq every time when such port is
added/updated to the network.

This patch adds skip in such case which should improve load on the
Neutron DHCP agent.

Closes-Bug: #1913269
Change-Id: I63221507713b941c261cdf88781133149da8ab8d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-22 02:01:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deletion of rfp interfaces when router is re-enabled

1. When dvr router is disabled and enabled back, the rfp
interfaces are deleted on the nodes without snat-* namespace.
This is due to creation of snat namespace during router
initialization stage on all the nodes. At later stages, since
the gw_port_host is not bounded on this node, external gateway
is removed which triggers removal of rfp interfaces and snat
namespace.
Create snat namespace only on the nodes where gw_port_host is
bounded.

2. In case of DVR SNAT, when the l3 agent is rescheduled to
another node, the rfp interfaces on qrouter-* namespace are
removed. Instead of calling external_gateway_removed() which
further deletes the rfp interfaces, the qg-, sg- interfaces
need to be unplugged and snat namespace need to be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1894843
Change-Id: Ic35c2f9bceacec8eeba67a2b1ea0cd0b0ffc72fe
(cherry picked from commit 393d484e07e53496ff068d14047c97d28febd03a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deletion of rfp interfaces when router is re-enabled

1. When dvr router is disabled and enabled back, the rfp
interfaces are deleted on the nodes without snat-* namespace.
This is due to creation of snat namespace during router
initialization stage on all the nodes. At later stages, since
the gw_port_host is not bounded on this node, external gateway
is removed which triggers removal of rfp interfaces and snat
namespace.
Create snat namespace only on the nodes where gw_port_host is
bounded.

2. In case of DVR SNAT, when the l3 agent is rescheduled to
another node, the rfp interfaces on qrouter-* namespace are
removed. Instead of calling external_gateway_removed() which
further deletes the rfp interfaces, the qg-, sg- interfaces
need to be unplugged and snat namespace need to be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1894843
Change-Id: Ic35c2f9bceacec8eeba67a2b1ea0cd0b0ffc72fe
(cherry picked from commit 393d484e07e53496ff068d14047c97d28febd03a)

commit_message:
Don't try to create default SG when security groups are disabled

If security group API is disabled, there is no point to create default
security group for tenant when e.g. network is created.

Closes-Bug: #1913297
Change-Id: Ib73babdd563e3e8c21ce6f63456cc87af414c5aa
(cherry picked from commit 013c183d7c1a16d07f5acae9e29b157b0ffd8fae)

commit_message:
Stop raising 403 when image is not found

Glance has a vestigial policy override knob that allows an operator
to force a 403 response when attempting to get an image from the DB
that is not found. This runs contrary to the API documentation, and
creates a (potential) interoperability concern across clouds with
differing policies on this topic.

This removes that override and changes the test from validating this
override to validating that it can no longer happen.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Ie24e3eb2f31d10d2ab9af62a0b645e8bdd0c2ff2
Closes-Bug: #1915543

commit_message:
Make _cleanup_volume_type non-private

_cleanup_volume_type is made public by this commit as
the tempest.scenario.manager interface is meant to be
consumed by tempest plugins.

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable

commit_message:
Disallow CONF.compute.max_disk_devices_to_attach = 0

The CONF.compute.max_disk_devices_to_attach option controls the maximum
number of disk devices allowed to attach to an instance. If it is set
to 0, it will literally allow no disk device for instances, preventing
them from being able to boot.

This adds a note to the config option help to call this out and changes
nova-compute to raise InvalidConfiguration during init_host if
[compute]max_disk_devices_to_attach has been set to 0. The nova-compute
service will fail to start if the option is set to 0.

Note: there doesn't appear to be any way to disallow particular values
in a oslo.config IntOpt other than the min/max values. Here we need the
min value to be -1 to represent unlimited. There is a 'choices' kwarg
available but that is only for enumerating valid values and we need to
allow any integer >= 1 as well.

Change-Id: I6e30468bc28f661ddc17937ab1de04a706f05063
Closes-Bug: #1897950
(cherry picked from commit 25a632a4e1daa1941a6297ddb51088972f23ce6d)
(cherry picked from commit 8e12b81839e1fb364b3598699fecf57c78f81df3)
(cherry picked from commit 4ad7e5e2630542bce4cfa53adafd1da299adb0f6)

commit_message:
sharding: Don't inject shard ranges when user says quit

When an operator does a `find_and_replace` on a DB that already has
shard ranges, they get a prompt like:

   This will delete existing 58 shard ranges.
   Do you want to show the existing ranges [s], delete the existing
   ranges [yes] or quit without deleting [q]?

Previously, if they selected `q`, we would skip the delete but still do
the merge (!) and immediately warn about how there are now invalid shard
ranges. Now, quit without merging.

Cherry-Picked-From: I7d869b137a6fbade59bb8ba16e4f3e9663e18822
Change-Id: I7ee69f0ca1aeef1004e61c45eeeb98dd35fe212e

commit_message:
Add net & utils methods for routed nets & segments

Before adding a prefilter, we need to add new methods for asking Neutron
about the related aggregates we need to ask Placement if the user
creates or moves an instance with a requested network or a port.

NOTE(sbauza): Looks like mypy doesn't like the current methods in
nova.network.neutron, so we need to fix the issues before adding this
module to mypy-files.txt.

Partially-Implements : blueprint routed-networks-scheduling

Change-Id: Ie166f3b51fddeaf916cda7c5ac34bbcdda0fd17a

commit_message:
Add skip funtion for checking enabled extensions in the l3 agent

This function check the extension configured in the l3 network agent
and if the extension is no enabled the test is skipped

That validation should not be applied when the l3 agent does not exist,
e.g.: OVN configurations

Change-Id: Icbc379d6b8ab0d720d2ae242d79949fb4dd9d27c

commit_message:
Remove transformers from pipeline.yaml

This change removes usage of transformers from pipeline.yaml because
support of transofermer was already removed from ceilometer[1].

[1] 9db5c6c9bfc66018aeb78c4a262e1bfa9b326798

Backport note:
This backport patch includes the subsequent change[2] to fix the wrong
file mentioned in the release note file.

[2] d27fbd3fed472a51670393a4a295ba6b16a35bea

Closes-Bug: #1912345
Change-Id: Ibadafdf86f5ce581c9084a5e00784eefa7d28cab

commit_message:
Fix broken configdrive_use_object_store

When it is set to True, we try to write text data to a binary file,
which is not possible in Python 3. The issue has been "helpfully"
hidden by the fact that we use bytes in unit tests, as well as
by lack of CI coverage.

Change-Id: Ibbf90dcbcb36a5f7cf084a44a221c0c5c003b95a

commit_message:
Remove mistral arg from generate_passwords

This argument is no longer used by the function, and was also masking an
error in how the function was called from
tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py[1] which is expecting the stack name
to be the 3rd arg.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/src/commit/35b7133d690ef5d0326c0f094802ce4a99fed6eb/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py#L116

Change-Id: I11de5d3d4c978d5efad506f0aa3e57992946e693
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add python3-pymemcache to tcib

pymemcache is required by services connecting to
Memcached with TLS. pymemcache will also likely replace
python-memcached alltogether, because of it's lack of
maintenance.

see: https://review.opendev.org/761612
Change-Id: Icbc02b14d89d7e84a27e6bf51869967b86f8b4a5

I guess what I'm saying is that eventlet is not special about imposing a hard cap openstack wide.  Honestly the new pip resolver 'should' solve this."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-11-06 08:14:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

At the moment I don't see how can I encourage eventlet devs to do something for us other than go and contribute the patches myself, which is not happening due to time constraints on my side.

ya, I never said the situation was nice (for either side), but putting caps in place just means we are another place that has to be check periodically for if the cap has been raised or removed. :|'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-11-06 08:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

rule to <2.0.0 to avoid a break when dnspython 2.1.0 is released.

Related-Bug: #1888237
Change-Id: I2acf0c3c6e7f919570fc35fb2bba668b7e3245a8
'}]
commit_message:
Pin dnspython < 2.0.0

As dsnpython 2.1.0 is around the corner and eventlet restricted the
dnspython version to < 2.0.0 we should change our dnspython!=2.0.0
rule to <2.0.0 to avoid a break when dnspython 2.1.0 is released.

Related-Bug: #1888237
Change-Id: I2acf0c3c6e7f919570fc35fb2bba668b7e3245a8

[{'created': '2020-10-06 17:40:15.000000000', 'message': 'Skip eventlet bug version for py3.7

There is a known bug for py3.7 and greater using the eventlet lib
with SSL [0]. Eventlet has released the version 0.26 that fixes
the bug. From that, it reverts what the patch [1] did, because it
was a workaround while the eventlet had not fixed the bug.

[0] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/526
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738476/

Change-Id: I3c41a3ebc3aaa04b31c347f1a6fd6e56f3c6c6cc
'}]
commit_message:
Skip eventlet bug version for py3.7

There is a known bug for py3.7 and greater using the eventlet lib
with SSL [0]. Eventlet has released the version 0.26 that fixes
the bug. From that, it reverts what the patch [1] did, because it
was a workaround while the eventlet had not fixed the bug.

[0] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/526
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738476/

Change-Id: I3c41a3ebc3aaa04b31c347f1a6fd6e56f3c6c6cc

subject: tests: Remove 'test_tcp_rst_no_compute_rpcapi'
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-23 17:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-23 17:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-23 17:24:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nhttps://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/741351 is a much nicer solution'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 17:21:04.000000000', 'message': "tests: Remove ;test_tcp_rst_no_compute_rpcapi'

Remove the 'test_tcp_rst_no_compute_rpcapi' test case. This test is not
correct. The 'self.wh' object is set to a proxy class that we mock to
inherit from a 'Mock' object, so unset variables are returned as mocked
values, which suggests this doesn't appear to have been testing what it
was expected to be testing. Along with a subtle change in Python 3.8 to
how this is mocked, the only way to get the test to pass would be to
mock the return value we are checking, so we would just be testing that
mocking works. This should probably be reimplemented as a functional
test since it tries to reach into external code to manipulate results.

Change-Id: Ic3f22308df7e015b6fb9531b178262aa776cf0a8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Melanie Witt <melwittt@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-02-23 17:23:04.000000000', 'message': "tests: Remove 'test_tcp_rst_no_compute_rpcapi'

Remove the 'test_tcp_rst_no_compute_rpcapi' test case. This test is not
correct. The 'self.wh' object is set to a proxy class that we mock to
inherit from a 'Mock' object, so unset variables are returned as mocked
values, which suggests this doesn't appear to have been testing what it
was expected to be testing. Along with a subtle change in Python 3.8 to
how this is mocked, the only way to get the test to pass would be to
mock the return value we are checking, so we would just be testing that
mocking works. This should probably be reimplemented as a functional
test since it tries to reach into external code to manipulate results.

Change-Id: Ic3f22308df7e015b6fb9531b178262aa776cf0a8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Melanie Witt <melwittt@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Remove 'test_tcp_rst_no_compute_rpcapi'

Remove the 'test_tcp_rst_no_compute_rpcapi' test case. This test is not
correct. The 'self.wh' object is set to a proxy class that we mock to
inherit from a 'Mock' object, so unset variables are returned as mocked
values, which suggests this doesn't appear to have been testing what it
was expected to be testing. Along with a subtle change in Python 3.8 to
how this is mocked, the only way to get the test to pass would be to
mock the return value we are checking, so we would just be testing that
mocking works. This should probably be reimplemented as a functional
test since it tries to reach into external code to manipulate results.

Change-Id: Ic3f22308df7e015b6fb9531b178262aa776cf0a8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Melanie Witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-22 13:51:17.000000000', 'message': "Handle EBRs and tiny partitions when removing metadata

Extended boot records (EBRs) are used in the MSDOS partitioning
scheme to manage extended partitions. EBRs are small partitions
themselves and Ironic will therefore treat them like any other
partition during cleaning. Since EBRs are smaller than a GPT
(33 sectors), dd'ing 33 sectors will fail. This patch proposes
a fix to handle EBRs (and other tiny paritions) by adjusting
the number of blocks writtent to be the partition size at max.

Story: #2008539
Task: #41628
Change-Id: Ie9809b3e4fe2bea6b66ee95c442111942e85d618
(cherry picked from commit 9a60d3853fc5b36cd3715e9419568cc9c51f5a8e)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle EBRs and tiny partitions when removing metadata

Extended boot records (EBRs) are used in the MSDOS partitioning
scheme to manage extended partitions. EBRs are small partitions
themselves and Ironic will therefore treat them like any other
partition during cleaning. Since EBRs are smaller than a GPT
(33 sectors), dd'ing 33 sectors will fail. This patch proposes
a fix to handle EBRs (and other tiny paritions) by adjusting
the number of blocks writtent to be the partition size at max.

Story: #2008539
Task: #41628
Change-Id: Ie9809b3e4fe2bea6b66ee95c442111942e85d618
(cherry picked from commit 9a60d3853fc5b36cd3715e9419568cc9c51f5a8e)

commit_message:
More robustly handle venv ovs/ovn paths

This should handle both src directories and system-installed ovs
and ovn, whether by package in /usr or by source in /usr/local.

This patchset also cherry picks from
commit 5d70d45f2d014cf265b68844122eadd541f5c3cf which included
pre-requisite changes for OvsOvnVenvFixture that were improved.
With that, this changes tools/setup-ovs.sh to take an OVS_BRANCH
env variable to use a specific branch.

Closes-Bug: 1856676

Conflicts:
  ovsdbapp/constants.py
  ovsdbapp/venv.py

Change-Id: Ib83859fb038c441064bcf3d5d96c31cface7d5c9
(cherry picked from commit 5d70d45f2d014cf265b68844122eadd541f5c3cf)
(cherry picked from commit 781ecb5bf648774f5d365585a0c2c13442523754)

commit_message:
Add config parameter for cinder mounting needs

This patch is introducing cinder_mount_point_base parameter into
glance::backend::multistore::cinder class, so that operators can
provide the cinder mount point for NFS volumes.

Change-Id: Ib724f6e895716847827be48ed08b01a7a312338f
(cherry picked from commit 46e9319d8e012d2df6b7d8f85f59315db6e95ff2)

commit_message:
Add a new role parameter rhsm_enforce.

With this new switch we can opt-out enforcement of the subscription
check for some composed role. This is mainly useful for composed Ceph
which have different constraint than other Openstack roles.

Closes-Bug: 1912512
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/776235

Change-Id: I46529ccab6c197da4885950282eb6731e28573d6
(cherry picked from commit cde398d9b49aaf44cd0cb40904bd8c979c51d33b)

This patch adds a new option to the PKCS#11 backend: `os_locking_ok`.
When set to true, the flag CKF_OS_LOCKING_OK is passed to the
C_Initialize function for the client library.

Change-Id: Iaa2a82718cb75e291a0b81b896bd136c29fa6fa0
'}]
commit_message:
Use system locks in pkcs11 library

This patch adds a new option to the PKCS#11 backend: `os_locking_ok`.
When set to true, the flag CKF_OS_LOCKING_OK is passed to the
C_Initialize function for the client library.

Change-Id: Iaa2a82718cb75e291a0b81b896bd136c29fa6fa0

commit_message:
Fix devstack-platform-xenial by using stable upper-constraints in Tempest venv

devstack-platform-xenial job need to use the compatile Tempest
version which is 23.0.0 and so does the compatible upper
constraints.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774913

Change-Id: I2703a84f6339336587f6932180b01d873ed1ec91

> Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1
> 
> It seems mgmt driver interface is changed (see. scale related code in vnflcm_driver.py).
> Please show the legitimacy of the change.

sorry I can't catch your question, may I confirm you question at first?
do you mean:
1. scale related code in vnflcm_driver.py is calling interface(scale_start/...) different from other interface(also scale_start is included in scale_pre)?

or

2. the reason/legitimacy of all interface calling change in vnflcm_driver?"}, {'account_id': 4149, 'date': '2021-01-25 22:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

> sorry I can't catch your question, may I confirm you question at first?
> do you mean:

Sorry for my poor quality of English.
My main concern is backward compatibility.
For instantiate, terminate and heal, there is no problem from the view point of backward compatibility
since only mgmt driver call added to the original code.
But it does not apply to scale related code.
For example _scale_vnf_pre, "self._vnfm_plugin.mgmt_call(context, vnf_info, kwargs)" is removed from
the original code and replaced to "self._mgmt_manager.invoke(...)".
It is not clear how this change keep backward compatibility.
I want to know the reason/legitimacy of this change.'}, {'account_id': 31821, 'date': '2021-01-26 02:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 31821, 'date': '2021-01-26 06:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1
> 
> > sorry I can't catch your question, may I confirm you question at first?
> > do you mean:
> 
> Sorry for my poor quality of English.
> My main concern is backward compatibility.
> For instantiate, terminate and heal, there is no problem from the view point of backward compatibility
> since only mgmt driver call added to the original code.
> But it does not apply to scale related code.
> For example _scale_vnf_pre, "self._vnfm_plugin.mgmt_call(context, vnf_info, kwargs)" is removed from
> the original code and replaced to "self._mgmt_manager.invoke(...)".
> It is not clear how this change keep backward compatibility.
> I want to know the reason/legitimacy of this change.

My explanation may not be very clear, in short,
"self._vnfm_plugin.mgmt_call" is the implementation of DriverManager that belongs to the Legacy (vnfm_plugin). This patch uses the new DriverManager instead of the old one based on the SOL.

Since the function that calls mgmt_call already exists in scale, in order not to destroy the structure of the original scale, the new "self._mgmt_manager.invoke" method is used to replace it.

The logic of scale_end was originally processed by the mgmt_call method under VnfMGMTAbstractDriver. 
After this modification, the scale_end is processed directly through Driver_manager of vnflcm_mgmt_driver.'}, {'account_id': 4149, 'date': '2021-01-26 23:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)

> My explanation may not be very clear, in short,
> "self._vnfm_plugin.mgmt_call" is the implementation of DriverManager that belongs to the Legacy (vnfm_plugin). This patch uses the new DriverManager instead of the old one based on the SOL.

Thank you for the reply. I understand the intention of the change.
But it seems to break backward compatibility (on the code at least).
I mean if a VNF package which uses mgmt driver call such as action type ACTION_SCALE_IN_VNF will not be run after this patch applied. 
I understand it is no problem for existing drivers on the tacker code base; VnfMgmtOpenWRT and VnfMgmtNoop. But there may be third party drivers. (if not I wonder why mgmt call exists on the original code.)
It is OK if the tacker community think there is no third party driver or they recognize it is useless code :-), and they think it is good chance to modify interface from legacy to new one.
But (I say again) there is backward incompatibility on the code at least. It should be documented anywhere.'}, {'account_id': 4149, 'date': '2021-01-26 23:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 31821, 'date': '2021-01-27 05:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 31821, 'date': '2021-02-01 04:48:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

>

>

> > "self._vnfm_plugin.mgmt_call" is the implementation of DriverManager that belongs to the Legacy (vnfm_plugin). This patch uses the new DriverManager instead of the old one based on the SOL.
> 
> Thank you for the reply. I understand the intention of the change.
> But it seems to break backward compatibility (on the code at least).
> I mean if a VNF package which uses mgmt driver call such as action type ACTION_SCALE_IN_VNF will not be run after this patch applied. 
> I understand it is no problem for existing drivers on the tacker code base; VnfMgmtOpenWRT and VnfMgmtNoop. But there may be third party drivers. (if not I wonder why mgmt call exists on the original code.)
> It is OK if the tacker community think there is no third party driver or they recognize it is useless code :-), and they think it is good chance to modify interface from legacy to new one.
> But (I say again) there is backward incompatibility on the code at least. It should be documented anywhere.

Thanks for comment. Let me fix your code review first.
For backward compatibility and interface design strategy, I will raise a topic in community IRC meeting about this change, I will contact you after Tuesday meeting.
It it truth this patch will no longer support legacy interfaces, loses backward incompatibility. Our opinion to discuss on IRC meeting is : 
1. should support SOL interface usage at initial, rather than user customize interface on legacy code.
2. since legacy code(action driver) is not complete with all interfaces and released 3 month ago, this is a good time to change to SOL implementation thoroughly.

anyway, I will contact you the result after meeting , best regards :)'}, {'account_id': 27880, 'date': '2021-02-02 23:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

LGTM, but can you update the conclusion of the discussion in IRC?'}, {'account_id': 31821, 'date': '2021-02-03 02:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1
> 
> LGTM, but can you update the conclusion of the discussion in IRC?

Our conclusion is:
1. We should call SOL scale operation here and drop unintentional logic calling legacy MgmtDriver code. 

2. For 3rd-party drivers support, we should continue discuss here.

IRC meeting log:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/tacker/2021/tacker.2021-02-02-08.05.log.txt

* Remove 3rd party driver support from Victoria release

Note:
* For UT, sqlalchemy is used, which calls functions in pymysql.py,
  so the dependency module PyMySQL needs to be added.

  depends on the default config in legacy ``VNFMPlugin`` class in
  tacker/vnfm/plugin.py, so we need to fix this here.

  for applications via MgmtDriver

* Call LCM methods from vnflcm_driver
* Fix unitentional mgmt_calls in vnflcm_driver._scale_vnf_pre

Note:
* For UT, sqlalchemy is used, which calls functions in pymysql.py,
  so the dependency module PyMySQL needs to be added.
* The previous implementation of ``cfg.CONF.tacker.infra_driver``
  depends on the default config in legacy ``VNFMPlugin`` class in
  tacker/vnfm/plugin.py, so we need to fix this here.
* Due to drop unitentional mgmt_calls, it makes compatibility breakage
  for some scale actions calls and third party driver support.

* Enable VNF vendors to customize configuration methods
  for applications via MgmtDriver

Note:

  so the dependency module PyMySQL needs to be added.

  depends on the default config in legacy ``VNFMPlugin`` class in
  tacker/vnfm/plugin.py, so we need to fix this here.

  backward incompatibility was decided to keep since it is not long

commit_message:
Implement SOL001 features to MgmtDriver

* Enable VNF vendors to customize configuration methods
  for applications via MgmtDriver
* Load LCM interface from vnfd file
* Call LCM methods from vnflcm_driver
* Fix unitentional mgmt_calls in vnflcm_driver._scale_vnf_pre

Note:
* For UT, sqlalchemy is used, which calls functions in pymysql.py,
  so the dependency module PyMySQL needs to be added.
* The previous implementation of ``cfg.CONF.tacker.infra_driver``
  depends on the default config in legacy ``VNFMPlugin`` class in
  tacker/vnfm/plugin.py, so we need to fix this here.
* Due to drop unitentional mgmt_calls, it makes compatibility breakage
  for some scale actions calls and third party driver support. This
  backward incompatibility was decided to keep since it is not long
  time since last change(Victoria release)

Change-Id: Ib4ad3eb9e0a84d1a5e807d2e6004e6b2c02bf3cf

Arguments against this:

* it pushes OVN-specific code into the general OVS role. Non-OVS users will have a bunch of skipped tasks, executing pretty much every host, which isn't great for performance.

Are there good arguments in favour of this approach?"}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-02-23 16:24:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Well, I haven't really thought about the skipped things, might be it doesn't make any sense - just we need to be better in OVN role to check if OVS tasks are carried out on hosts in openvswitch group.

commit_message:
Use ansible_facts instead

In order to ANSIBLE_INJECT_FACT_VARS=False we have to use ansible_facts
instead of ansible_* vars. This change switches our distribution and
hostname related items to use ansible_facts instead.

Change-Id: Id01e754f0cf9f6e98c02f45a4011f3d6f59f80a1
Related-Bug: #1915761

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-25 14:48:15.000000000', 'message': 'Option to remove the self-installed ReaR cron task

By default, the ReaR rpm installs a cronjob on /etc/cron.d/rear with
a default programming. This programming runs a backup job at
1:30AM every day. During this automatic backup, the services are not
appropiately paused. This causes the created backup to have non-valid
data.

As the most recent backup overwrites the older ones, this deletes
the "good" backup taken at operator's discretion with a new one
that cannot be used to restore the control plane state.

This change aims to optionally disable this default rpm behaviour.

Closes-Bug: #1912764
Change-Id: I2582c1ba74ae115a94ecb4524ba34e79ea5b43e8
'}, {'created': '2021-02-04 14:05:45.000000000', 'message': 'Option to remove the self-installed ReaR cron task

By default, the ReaR rpm installs a cronjob on /etc/cron.d/rear with
a default programming. This programming runs a backup job at
1:30AM every day. During this automatic backup, the services are not
appropiately paused. This causes the created backup to have non-valid
data.

As the most recent backup overwrites the older ones, this deletes
the "good" backup taken at operator's discretion with a new one
that cannot be used to restore the control plane state.

This change aims to optionally disable this default rpm behaviour.

Closes-Bug: #1912764
Change-Id: I2582c1ba74ae115a94ecb4524ba34e79ea5b43e8
'}]
commit_message:
Option to remove the self-installed ReaR cron task

By default, the ReaR rpm installs a cronjob on /etc/cron.d/rear with
a default programming. This programming runs a backup job at
1:30AM every day. During this automatic backup, the services are not
appropiately paused. This causes the created backup to have non-valid
data.

As the most recent backup overwrites the older ones, this deletes
the "good" backup taken at operator's discretion with a new one
that cannot be used to restore the control plane state.

This change aims to optionally disable this default rpm behaviour.

Closes-Bug: #1912764
Change-Id: I2582c1ba74ae115a94ecb4524ba34e79ea5b43e8

commit_message:
Implement system scoped RBAC for the allocation APIs

This commit updates the policies for baremetal allocation policies to
understand scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a
broader series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC
experience and improve security.

Change-Id: I1cb3a7e885710c19f20df63b83beaa787ffa3bc3

subject: Implement system scoped RBAC for utility APIs

commit_message:
Implement system scoped RBAC for utility APIs

This commit updates the policies for baremetal utility policies to understand
scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader
series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and
improve security.

Also adds duplicate Heartbeat and Lookup test classes with the middleware
scope enforcement enabled and enforced, to ensure that we do not adversely
impact these special API endpoints.

Change-Id: I89176b3adf1489e12493c62b908bf135c912e017

subject: Implement system scoped RBAC for conductor APIs

commit_message:
Implement system scoped RBAC for conductor APIs

This commit updates the policies for baremetal conductor policies to understand
scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader
series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and
improve security.

Change-Id: I331f46092405ffd399ad45ba4ccb6dc7639051e5

subject: Implement system scoped RBAC for volume APIs

commit_message:
Implement system scoped RBAC for volume APIs

This commit updates the policies for baremetal volume policies to understand
scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader
series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and
improve security.

Change-Id: I361a6410f5825b2dc97b50586475a4fa8e0f0f1f

commit_message:
Do not remove domain hints prematurely

check for identity driver domain awareness and remove domain hints
immediately before the list_users method of identity driver called,
so that the original hints are in effect when querying federation
provider.

Change-Id: Ib79dec1e53b0ca9ad402891652f77a581b845cf2
Closes-Bug: #1893794

commit_message:
Use ansible_facts

ansible_pkg_mgr requires that the facts be injected as vars. We should
use ansible_facts instead.

Change-Id: I84ae549b549363d32207dff324657dd7df1f5ac0

commit_message:
Fix CI

Cap ansible at <2.10 and fix hacking. Additionally convert ansible-lint
to not use the old shell script and use .ansible-lint for skips

Change-Id: I035ed9f3964ba904dc9ccfe048b69a68c6680253

commit_message:
Implement system scoped RBAC for node and driver passthru

This commit updates the policies for baremetal passthru policies to understand
scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader
series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and
improve security.

Change-Id: I31a258e0ce7db7e931e62f2a06e610857dabdd47

subject: Implement system scoped RBAC for baremetal drivers

commit_message:
Implement system scoped RBAC for baremetal drivers

This commit updates the policies for baremetal drivers to understand scope
checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of
changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve
security.

Change-Id: I7e2f205a5fbc186bfdaf2f5f58fb3b07abc9765d

[{'created': '2021-01-30 08:27:10.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: Iaa040f10028935782d8315efc81d344e72b2a152

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: Iaa040f10028935782d8315efc81d344e72b2a152

commit_message:
Implement system scoped RBAC for chassis

This commit updates the policies for baremetal chassis to understand scope
checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of
changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve
security.

Change-Id: I5ecb44a389b057519599c7b812f8c913db4f085a

subject: Don't update AgentCache when Chassis_Private.chassis == []

[{'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-02-08 18:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-02-08 20:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/774529/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 07m 07s'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-02-09 11:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-02-10 21:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

While one *could* create a transaction that deletes both at the same time, the events would still come separately for each row. The Chassis/Chassis_Private is only ever deleted (to the best of my knowledge) by ovn-controller shutting down gracefully. Otherwise, it's just when we delete it (and we only delete the Chassis). If ovn-controller is still up, the Chassis will be re-created.

Basically, in the "real" case where ovn-controller is ungracefully killed and we delete the Chassis and ovsdb-server also clears the Chassis_Private.chassis since it is a ref. We get DELETE event for the Chssis and an UPDATE event for the Chassis_Private.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-02-10 21:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-02-16 18:19:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> While one *could* create a transaction that deletes both at the same time, the events would still come separately for each row. The Chassis/Chassis_Private is only ever deleted (to the best of my knowledge) by ovn-controller shutting down gracefully. Otherwise, it's just when we delete it (and we only delete the Chassis). If ovn-controller is still up, the Chassis will be re-created.
> 
> Basically, in the "real" case where ovn-controller is ungracefully killed and we delete the Chassis and ovsdb-server also clears the Chassis_Private.chassis since it is a ref. We get DELETE event for the Chssis and an UPDATE event for the Chassis_Private.

Thanks for the explanation!'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-02-17 08:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-02-18 08:46:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-02-18 10:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/774529/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 48m 41s'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-02-22 17:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-02-22 18:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-08 18:44:23.000000000', 'message': 'Don't update AgentCache when Chassis_Private.chassis == []

When we delete a Chassis object when deleting an agent, the
corresponding value in Chassis_Private.chassis is automatically
set to []. Even though we use frozen rows, since we listen for
updates to Chassis_Private, we will replace the row in the
AgentCache with this new "chassis-less" entry, which will break
things since Chassis_Private.chassis is used to display information
which is only stored there like 'hostname'.

This patch avoids updating the AgentCache when Chassis_Private
has an empty Chassis field.

Related-Bug: #1914757
Change-Id: Iad01db7f33d6c61b29c552d2dc8893e2946a369a
'}]
commit_message:
Don't update AgentCache when Chassis_Private.chassis == []

When we delete a Chassis object when deleting an agent, the
corresponding value in Chassis_Private.chassis is automatically
set to []. Even though we use frozen rows, since we listen for
updates to Chassis_Private, we will replace the row in the
AgentCache with this new "chassis-less" entry, which will break
things since Chassis_Private.chassis is used to display information
which is only stored there like 'hostname'.

This patch avoids updating the AgentCache when Chassis_Private
has an empty Chassis field.

Related-Bug: #1914757
Change-Id: Iad01db7f33d6c61b29c552d2dc8893e2946a369a

commit_message:
Add support for management of osc-placement package

This patch introduces a new class, placement::client, so that operators
can manage pythonN-osc-placement package.

backport note 1:
Because stable/train still uses absolute names to include puppet
classes, all usage of relative names are replaced.

backport note 2:
This change include the fix about the wrong client package name in unit
tests[1].
 [1] e1fedebded690f509be5a191ea2ce9d96f3eff70

Change-Id: I76eb105ca532e427e4f48f84ccb5c15532456fda
(cherry picked from commit 0a59d6767a958b72b3ef383ce0e91bdf7eebd6c5)
(cherry picked from commit a8a9b300f50ec9e26ac392a8712a6530e1d9bf2a)

subject: Copy scenario manager and avoid using the Tempest unstable interface
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-23 01:26:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-23 01:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Topic bp/would removed'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-23 01:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bp/tempest-scenario-manager-stable'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-23 01:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-23 01:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-02-23 08:23:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If we go this way, older releases of cinder-tempest-plugin won't be compatible with new tempest release(s) - that might not be a problem, but if it is, we will have delay the scenario manager work about a release or 2 so that we don't break the relation between cinder-tempest-plugin and tempest. This approach was good years back, when it was implemented in all the plugins at once and there was a huge refactoring plan planned for tempest's scenario.manager, however, now when we're almost finished with that and only a few plugins (cinder-tempest-plugin, maybe a few others) are dependent on tempest.scenario.manager, I'm not so sure this is the right way to go.

This patch is supposed to help with a rename on tempest's side: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/776932
Why don't we do the following on tempest's side instead:
```
_foo():
    # TODO delete in 27 release (whatever release we feel is appropriate)
    warning()
    foo()
foo()
   <_foo's logic>
```
That way ^^ any combination of tempest and cinder-tempest-plugin will have no problem to interact with each other."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-02-23 08:54:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If we merge https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/702495, wouldn't that be enough?"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-02-23 09:02:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> If we go this way, older releases of cinder-tempest-plugin won't be compatible with new tempest release(s) 


In the past, when breaking changes happened in an unstable interface, it was the plugin responsibility to fix them and restore the compatibility.
While I agree that, given the long-standing unresolved status of the scenario manager, a smoother transition may be planned instead, I can't really block this change."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-02-23 09:29:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Let's do it in different patches; we need 
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/702495 (hopefully merging soon)
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/777074 (may need a few fixes)"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-23 14:02:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> If we go this way, older releases of cinder-tempest-plugin won't be compatible with new tempest release(s) - that might not be a problem, but if it is, we will have delay the scenario manager work about a release or 2 so that we don't break the relation between cinder-tempest-plugin and tempest. This approach was good years back, when it was implemented in all the plugins at once and there was a huge refactoring plan planned for tempest's scenario.manager, however, now when we're almost finished with that and only a few plugins (cinder-tempest-plugin, maybe a few others) are dependent on tempest.scenario.manager, I'm not so sure this is the right way to go.
> 
> This patch is supposed to help with a rename on tempest's side: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/776932
> Why don't we do the following on tempest's side instead:
> ```
> _foo():
>     # TODO delete in 27 release (whatever release we feel is appropriate)
>     warning()
>     foo()
> foo()
>    <_foo's logic>
> ```
> That way ^^ any combination of tempest and cinder-tempest-plugin will have no problem to interact with each other.

yeah we do not need to maintain the compatibility of old cinder-tempest-plugin and tempest master. In every release we release the tempest and plugins compatible versions which is what we will use in our CI/CD and in production testing also. 

Also scenario manager was never a stable interface and every plugins had copy of that to avoid any break and so does this plugin can also do. I think bets way is to merge this asap and then we can merge the https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/776932"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-23 14:03:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> Let's do it in different patches; we need 
> https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/702495 (hopefully merging soon)
> https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/777074 (may need a few fixes)

nice, let's wait for 702495"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-23 14:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

in favor of https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/+/702495'}]

commit_message:
Copy scenario manager and avoid using the Tempest unstable interface

Tempest.scenaio.manager is not stable interface yet and Tempest
team is making many changes in that to make it stable for
plugins. Until then we need make a copy of it so that any
change done as part of below BP would not cause any break in
cinder-tempest-plugin

- https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22bp%252Ftempest-scenario-manager-stable%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

This keep only cinder related methods.

Related blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable

Change-Id: I5e98dfe22b107e56bd00f285d8cd527adadb206b

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Ia2ddcf868967c281cddd394c7c61acba2a62db6c

subject: Glance: Use volumev3 internal API of Cinder
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-02-13 09:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-02-13 09:34:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This change has no effect because we use cinder_store_auth_address and the other parameters.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-02-23 13:55:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ack, this should be abandoned because the THT accomplishes the goal of using cinder's v3 internal API by configuring other related parameters. And if we had to set the value, it would need to be done in puppet-tripleo because with glance multistore, it's a defined resource in puppet-glance that doesn't bind to hiera."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-02-23 14:10:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Ack, this should be abandoned because the THT accomplishes the goal of using cinder's v3 internal API by configuring other related parameters. And if we had to set the value, it would need to be done in puppet-tripleo because with glance multistore, it's a defined resource in puppet-glance that doesn't bind to hiera.

Yeah, you are correct. I didn't notice that point either.

Another point I'd like to mention again is that glance in TripleO deployment doesn't depend on the cinder_catalog_info parameter, because we set credential parameters like cinder_store_user_name in TripleO. And this is why I abandoned this change.

Just FYI I submitted a patch to glance_store to update its default value of cinder_catalog_info. I know that cinder will remove v2 api but that change should be merged before that removal...
 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance_store/+/775497"}]

[{'created': '2021-02-13 09:31:57.000000000', 'message': 'Glance: Use volumev3 internal API of Cinder

This change ensures that Glance uses volumev3 internal API when it
communicates with Cinder. Now glance_store use volumev2 public API but
volumev2 is already deprecated and internal API is more suitable for
communication between OpenStack components.

Change-Id: I6336c3305785113bbef418db06d54cc7edb920eb
'}]
commit_message:
Glance: Use volumev3 internal API of Cinder

This change ensures that Glance uses volumev3 internal API when it
communicates with Cinder. Now glance_store use volumev2 public API but
volumev2 is already deprecated and internal API is more suitable for
communication between OpenStack components.

Change-Id: I6336c3305785113bbef418db06d54cc7edb920eb

[{'created': '2021-01-18 13:15:52.000000000', 'message': 'Make lower-constraints job non-voting

l-c job recently failed too much, and maintaining it is huge job.

commit_message:
Make lower-constraints job non-voting

l-c job recently failed too much, and maintaining it is huge job.
As on stable branches we decided (see [1]) to drop l-c testing, meke
non-voting it for networking-bgpvpn in check queue, and remove from
gate queue.

[1]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: Ib5628cf79ab8bc099fb5f8b00f5302a34fa26655

subject: Fix db migrations with postgresql
messages:
[{'account_id': 28514, 'date': '2018-07-31 12:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-07-31 12:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Changes to existing migration scripts are not possible. Please refer to Michael's comment on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557797/

"I will also note, we cannot change existing migration scripts. Anyone upgrading an existing neutron-lbaas environment would not get this change. All schema changes must be their own migration.
Ping us in the #openstack-lbaas channel if you have more questions."'}, {'account_id': 28514, 'date': '2018-07-31 13:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

the modified migration scripts should not change the schema but enable successful migration on other engines, how else could you fix this issue for newly created databases?'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2018-08-27 07:14:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

If migration is not working on PostrgeSQL, the only way to fix to change it, but it should continue working for MySQL.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-08-27 07:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Changing existing alembic migrations will break existing environments.
Your fix should have a separate migration script.

Feel free to reach out on #openstack-lbaas on FreeNode.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2018-08-27 09:12:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Nir
If this migration is not working for PostrgeSQL there is no other the way to fix except changing current migration. New migration won't help as this one will still failing and goes before the new one.
I had such examples during my work on Neutron migrations."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-08-27 09:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-08-27 10:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-08-27 10:20:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Fair point Ann. will remove my vote for now.
We do need to be very careful not to break existing environments with this so I'll keep a close eye here.

I see that migrations were doing okay[1] here with MySQL, but we have no CI tests for PostgreSQL.

Adding Michael to hear his opinion.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/00/587400/1/check/neutron-lbaasv2-dsvm-api/ff0f850/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-07-31_13_03_12_975"}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2018-08-27 10:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28514, 'date': '2021-02-23 13:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the gating repo is release aware

In Patch[1] we missed C7 release files.

The gating repo is specific for the release.
This is critical for upgrade jobs.

The gating repo name is changed to gating-repo-$release
Then force copied to gating.repo for consistency in [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/765835
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/765834

Closes-Bug: #1916561
Change-Id: Iac65da9079eb504c6f3e36a0285f0b487ae9a11e

commit_message:

The default facts gathering is set to false.

commit_message:
Stop standalone cinder containers during upgrade

This change ensures that standalone cinder-volume and cinder-backup,
which are not managed by pacemaker, are surelly stopped during upgrade,
to follow what we do for the other standalone services.

Change-Id: I0df046c654d104bb2138365fe9d7bbce85bfc596

commit_message:
Adds connectivity test for SCTP service

This patch adds a new test to check SCTP connectivity from pods.
The 'create_setup_for_service_test' and 'assert_backend_amount_from_pod'
functions were also extended to support SCTP services. The kuryr-sctp
application was also extended to support connection with IPv6 address family.

Partially-Implements: blueprint sctp-support
Change-Id: Ic63a2807238d3d879bb172d74b05bada2399f07f

commit_message:
Make *every* 'Rule' attribute read-only

We obviously can't do much about people accessing the private functions,
but this should avoid some obvious bugs. If people want to change the
rules, they should either state a different definition in a file or
change the definition in code.

Change-Id: If1246a2a47bc5039c68eed418dc7bc1e2407a342
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add SITE_PACKAGES variable to horizon extend_start

This change adds a missing export. Without this change the horizon
dashboards are all broken becuase the functions are able to
correctly copy the dashboards plugins to the appropriate locations.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5fa3bb41403620e8bd9521e3c0e61570e202148f
(cherry picked from commit 8daeeef06733500efff45faf8f6a44ba0e48ecad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-18 13:59:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix manila-share with ceph-nfs backend

Currently when you deploy manila-share with a ceph-nfs backend
we get the following error:
Error: pcs -f
/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20210107-48280-1y4rwmx
constraint colocation add openstack-manila-share with ceph-nfs INFINITY
failed: Error: Resource 'ceph-nfs' does not exist. Too many tries

The reason for it is that we moved the pcs resource creation to the host
and outside containers
https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22pcs_host3%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

But when the ceph-nfs pcmk resource gets created at step 5, the
manila-share puppet code has already been invoked and since it requires
the ceph-nfs resource to be available it fails like above.

Let's move the ceph-nfs creation to step4 to solve this.

Closes-Bug: #1910732

Change-Id: Ifb81d155cbb4598a311c8e6fe90be951a8e7e656
(cherry picked from commit 06e131882b563576da55886d2bd5ffe769df41e5)
(cherry picked from commit 6d335056a39f8ee33a708f5b9556fc7663e5023e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix manila-share with ceph-nfs backend

Currently when you deploy manila-share with a ceph-nfs backend
we get the following error:
Error: pcs -f
/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20210107-48280-1y4rwmx
constraint colocation add openstack-manila-share with ceph-nfs INFINITY
failed: Error: Resource 'ceph-nfs' does not exist. Too many tries

The reason for it is that we moved the pcs resource creation to the host
and outside containers
https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22pcs_host3%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

But when the ceph-nfs pcmk resource gets created at step 5, the
manila-share puppet code has already been invoked and since it requires
the ceph-nfs resource to be available it fails like above.

Let's move the ceph-nfs creation to step4 to solve this.

Closes-Bug: #1910732

Change-Id: Ifb81d155cbb4598a311c8e6fe90be951a8e7e656
(cherry picked from commit 06e131882b563576da55886d2bd5ffe769df41e5)
(cherry picked from commit 6d335056a39f8ee33a708f5b9556fc7663e5023e)

commit_message:
Ensure openssl is available

This is required to create the self signed certificate. Minimal
container images may not contain the openssl package.

Change-Id: Id0535cc66671077f8100e66584a9432d5c3d996d

commit_message:
Drop service facts usage

This change switches from using service facts to using systemctl
commands to do service checks. This is done to reduce the amount of
memory used as part of the deployment.

Change-Id: I0cd5b24933e50680baefd055d6e68e277ab09315
Related-Bug: #1915761
(cherry picked from commit f9100964f976dd2a590973f313fa6a2449d37b3f)

commit_message:
Use utility container for Octavia keypair generation in AIO

Having removed the openstacksdk from the base host in
https://review.opendev.org/774472, the Octavia variables need
pointing at the correct host and Python interpreter for keypair
generation.

Change-Id: I96340641291f5532661c9288429258d90f33dbe6

Looks like there's a problem with one of the test bundles: https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-keystone-saml-mellon/+bug/1881267"}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-02 14:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-02 14:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-02 16:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Added another review and a change suggestion based on the latest test failure.

Thanks for getting it this far.'}, {'account_id': 31052, 'date': '2020-06-02 20:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Published edit on patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 31052, 'date': '2020-06-02 20:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 10:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 10:13:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I did some refactoring:

    * renamed the added config option since auto-updating is not something
      specific to mellon but rather a desired charm behavior. The primary
      function of this option is to use a URL to retrieve medata and
      auto-updating comes as a bonus due to the current charm
      implementation (config is rendered on every hook execution and
      services are restarted if there are actual changes);
    * added more unit tests to cover cases where
      * a resource hasn't been provided;
      * a URL provided in the config option is invalid;
      * invalid XML is returned after performing a request to the specified
        URL.

Will need another core reviewer to approve this though."}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 13:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 13:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

keystone-saml-mellon/2            blocked   idle            172.17.111.16                      Configuration is incomplete. idp-metadata: idp-metadata resource has not been provided,sp-private-key: resource is not a well-formed RFC 5958 (PKCS#8) key'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 13:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

I made another change to make sure the status message correctly reflects the lack of resources and modified tests.yaml.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 14:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

vault/0*                   error        idle        15       172.17.111.6                       hook failed: "install"

Looks unrelated to the change.

I am going to download a crashdump and check this while another recheck is done.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 14:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 16:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 18:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-03 19:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-06-04 13:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Looks like a different issue altogether - charm-keystone tries to operate on a string in relation data before it is written.

commit_message:
Add "idp-metadata-url" option

Add an option to allow retrieving the IDP metadata from a URL and
keeping the metadata auto-updated on charm hook execution.

Change-Id: I65b20e52835497a3fe57571794f332b2b4327fba
Signed-off-by: Yanos Angelopoulos <yanos@admin.grnet.gr>
Co-authored-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>
Co-authored-by: Dmitrii Shcherbakov <dmitrii.shcherbakov@canonical.com>

commit_message:
[WIP]Support AEP, sst at introspection data

AEP represents a non-volatile storage technology;
VNNI means the CPU supports deep learning;
Intel sst is a CPU capability; we use 'bf' as the cpu flags of this feature.

Story: 2008438
Task: 41400

Co-authored-by: Jerry Wang <jerry.a.wang@intel.com>
Change-Id: I44a063aee96d6a54977413b06d6a49b57f6b6c9f

commit_message:
Don't install centos-linux-release on 8-stream

This package doesn't exist in the stream base repo, and neither does
centos-linux-repos.

These are presumably replaced by centos-stream-release and
centos-stream-repos. This change adds an else block to handle the
non-stream base packages.

Change-Id: I32249199c3dfa44fc24fba28d24f314112c2e200

commit_message:
Ensure action renders config and sets up port

This change ensures that the octavia.conf rendered in the
configure-resource action includes OVN config if in an OVN
environment. It also ensures that setup_hm_port is run inside the
action rather than being deferred to a subsequent hook execution.

Change-Id: I978cce15c2e454372797fe7b2279eda92b9f6ff3
Closes-Bug: #1916008
Closes-Bug: #1916010

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-01 10:30:38.000000000', 'message': "FC: Fix not flushing on detach

When doing multipathed Fibre Channel we may end up not flushing the
volume when disconnecting it if didn't find a multipath when doing
the connection.

The issue is caused by the `connect_volume` call returning a real path
instead of a symlink and us passing the wrong device_info to the
_remove_devices method, which makes the disconnect code incorrectly
identify when a multipath was used to decide whether to do a flush or
not.

This patch fixes these things in order to flush the individual path when
necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1897787
Change-Id: Ie3266c81b3c6bb5a2c213a12410539d404d1febe
"}]
commit_message:
FC: Fix not flushing on detach

When doing multipathed Fibre Channel we may end up not flushing the
volume when disconnecting it if didn't find a multipath when doing
the connection.

The issue is caused by the `connect_volume` call returning a real path
instead of a symlink and us passing the wrong device_info to the
_remove_devices method, which makes the disconnect code incorrectly
identify when a multipath was used to decide whether to do a flush or
not.

This patch fixes these things in order to flush the individual path when
necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1897787
Change-Id: Ie3266c81b3c6bb5a2c213a12410539d404d1febe
