[{'created': '2021-02-11 21:46:44.000000000', 'message': "Bump up probe test timeout

There's been a roughly 5x increase in timeouts in the last three months,
which was itself about a 10x increase from the three months prior. Let's
get timeouts to be the exception, not the norm.

FWIW, some stats over the past two and a half years:

  Quarter | Median    | Timeouts
          | Pass Time |
  --------+-----------+---------
   2018Q1 |     19.0m |        2
   2018Q2 |     24.5m |       19
   2018Q3 |     26.8m |        3
   2018Q4 |     29.0m |        2
   2019Q1 |     31.0m |        0

(cherry picked from commit 5eb677fe505f41e4d039e3a699270609004261ab)

commit_message:
Bump up probe test timeout

There's been a roughly 5x increase in timeouts in the last three months,
which was itself about a 10x increase from the three months prior. Let's
get timeouts to be the exception, not the norm.

FWIW, some stats over the past two and a half years:

  Quarter | Median    | Timeouts
          | Pass Time |
  --------+-----------+---------
   2018Q1 |     19.0m |        2
   2018Q2 |     24.5m |       19
   2018Q3 |     26.8m |        3
   2018Q4 |     29.0m |        2
   2019Q1 |     31.0m |        0
   2019Q2 |     31.7m |        4
   2019Q3 |     32.7m |        1
   2019Q4 |     33.7m |        2
   2020Q1 |     46.4m |       25
   2020Q2 |     47.5m |      134

Change-Id: Iab60b952dfd1060f1166e5a07c9298c75e6831f1
(cherry picked from commit 5eb677fe505f41e4d039e3a699270609004261ab)

commit_message:
Update README to new rolevar for run-temepst role

Tempest replaced the below rolevar for run-tempest role
- tempest_test_blacklist is replaced by tempest_test_exclude_list
- tempest_black_regex is replaced by tempest_exclude_regex

old name are still supported for compatiblity but we recommend
to switch to new one.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774835
Change-Id: Icf2c72cbee88fc0bfa60c6f33fb0b25e436a3c9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-09 15:36:04.000000000', 'message': 'find_compactable_shard_sequences: fix skipped range

Fix the find_compactable_shard_sequences function to prevent skipping
a shard range after finding a sequence of compactable shard ranges
that approaches the merge size.

Previously a compactable sequence would correctly terminate on the nth
shard range if the n+1th shard range would take the object count over
the merge_size, but the n+1th shard range would then be skipped and
not considered for the start of the next sequence.

Also, add unit tests for find_compactable_shard_ranges in test_sharder.

Change-Id: I670441e7426b28ab2247563c7fa854d1cd502316

commit_message:
find_compactible_shard_sequences: fix skipped range

Fix the find_compactible_shard_sequences function to prevent skipping
a shard range after finding a sequence of compactible shard ranges
that approaches the merge size.

Previously a compactible sequence would correctly terminate on the nth
shard range if the n+1th shard range would take the object count over
the merge_size, but the n+1th shard range would then be skipped and
not considered for the start of the next sequence.

Change-Id: I670441e7426b28ab2247563c7fa854d1cd502316

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore,
* extract_messages
* compile_catalog
* update_catalog
As Babel can generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: I2ec08d6b9c26795f77226e324d642662412fe0de

commit_message:
Remove json_error callback

This change removes the json_error callback plugin. This plugin does not work, as seen in the
logs:

    [WARNING]: Failure using method (v2_playbook_on_stats) in callback plugin (<ans
    ible.plugins.callback./usr/share/ansible/plugins/callback/json_error.CallbackMo
    dule object at 0x7f6ee2270dd0>): [Errno 13] Permission denied: 'ansible-
    errors.json'

Given this plugin has no value, due to it being broken for a long time, we're removing it which
will stop the warning being raised in our ansible output.

* The test_json_error_callback role has also been removed, given this no longer serves any purpose.
* The molecule test layout has been updated so that we're no longer running this test.

Change-Id: I76cd51df4ff26b22f3d9b590ceded848581d4c3d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6fd612c8fba6abe8d6ca465937f3456a49d66bb9)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary API description in API-DQ

In VNF LCM API document, there is a Notification API
where Tacker doesn't have an endpoint.
Therefore, the API definition is unnecessary and
should be removed.

Change-Id: If0272e3211da2c1372551fcb47f8bf99c10a468e
Closes-Bug: #1913665

commit_message:
Stop non-pcmk services of manila and cinder during upgrade

This change implements missing external_upgrade_tasks for non-pcmk
services of manila and cinder, to ensure that we don't have mixed
versions of controller services running at the same time during
upgrade.

These tasks should have been implemented in the initial patch[1], but
missed at that time unfortunately.

 [1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: I35ea4354a7448a23d6517f9777ed022caa79347a
(cherry picked from commit 60c22c38ccfd253dec3766ad58c4b16d3a74f467)
(cherry picked from commit 0223e9ab6349ce1cc855ee75dfe44ed190febc6c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-02 17:16:37.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: ovn: Detect OVN DB schema change on reconnection

OVN introduced Chassis_Private table that is used by OVN mechanism
driver for agent API. Because this table is quite new, it may happen OVN
database is updated while neutron-server and its workers are running.

This patch creates a fanout event for SB DB Connection table. Every type
OVN SB IDL is reconnected, it checks if chassis_private table is newly
present in the schema but not in the schema helper. If needed, table
used for agent healthchecks is change in runtime from Chassis to
Chassis_Private.

Change-Id: I679945b68acf391901c8602fb1828c46cd1eec55
Closes-bug: #1901527
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-11-13 11:19:08.000000000', 'message': 'Use agent chassis table based on schema

The patch determines a table that should be used for the agent API
in the runtime, based on the current available schema. It means OVN
database can be updated or downgraded while neutron-server is running
and agents will always report its liveness based on currently available
tables.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/762562/
Change-Id: I679945b68acf391901c8602fb1828c46cd1eec55
Closes-bug: #1901527
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-11-18 18:02:52.000000000', 'message': 'Use agent chassis table based on schema

commit_message:
Use agent chassis table based on schema

The patch determines a table that should be used for the agent API
in the runtime, based on the current available schema. It means OVN
database can be updated or downgraded while neutron-server is running
and agents will always report its liveness based on currently available
tables.

Change-Id: I679945b68acf391901c8602fb1828c46cd1eec55
Closes-bug: #1901527
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add 'which' package to utility container

This is required internally by the openstack cli tool to create
the bash completion. The command is missing from the centos-8.3
container image so ensure that it is present.

Change-Id: I31880ca995735b737d33532eaa4c29be02523117

[{'created': '2021-02-10 23:52:50.000000000', 'message': 'Use master for zuul branch if not already set

This commit sets the default zuul branch to master if the
ZUUL_BRANCH environment variable is not set.

This has tripped us up when following the unit testing guide at:
https://docs.openstack.org/puppet-openstack-guide/latest/contributor/testing.html
and trying to run the tests results in the following error:
The git source https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper is not yet
checked out. Please run `bundle install` before trying to start your application

Change-Id: Ifd6dcd3c0274556b13d50f75ca34a4b8ab23c12a
'}]
commit_message:
Use master for zuul branch if not already set

This commit sets the default zuul branch to master if the
ZUUL_BRANCH environment variable is not set.

This has tripped us up when following the unit testing guide at:
https://docs.openstack.org/puppet-openstack-guide/latest/contributor/testing.html
and trying to run the tests results in the following error:
The git source https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper is not yet
checked out. Please run `bundle install` before trying to start your application

Change-Id: Ifd6dcd3c0274556b13d50f75ca34a4b8ab23c12a

take.

commit_message:
Set dhcp_domain for all nova services

This is required for nova-compute so move to init.pp from metadata.pp and set
DEFAULT/dhcp_domain (which nova should undeprecate) vs api/dhcp_domain.

Change-Id: If6a26527a737a7184ebddd5b4bc346d64827e9e3
Related-bug: #1903908
Related-bug: #1832537
(cherry picked from commit 71276558e77c8612397d0e31187cc8eec4554ff9)
(cherry picked from commit 5e4cee430393ff8df1c587112309a54a83189ef0)

commit_message:
Add TLS options to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Original oslo.cache change:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.cache/+/725405

Change-Id: I415cfee6045cd904e9675b97750c5de2f1be55d3
(cherry picked from commit 5a8dc2b7525d58f241cbeea1ae1631d22ce87481)
(cherry picked from commit a0d1e4650e8be4008628dbc68ea507e09735d2c9)

Add Octavia job for testing Load Balancer

Add basic test for LB.
Configure Octavia job which will run on LB changes only.

subject: Allow use custom uppper constraints in stable/stein
messages:
[{'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-02-04 10:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-02-04 12:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-04 14:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1 Workflow-1

we still use master Tempest for stein which we should switch to use 26.0.0. +1 until then (I will push that today) with -W. otherwise it looks good.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-04 17:11:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1 -Workflow

I see the original purpose of those change now. We do not need it for stable stein. 

We had to add these workaround until stable/rocky because tox.ini in Tempest used to use the master constraint for old tag. For example Tempest 23.0.0 : https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/23.0.0/tox.ini#L12

But we solved that issue for Tempest 25.0.0 onwards. Stable Stein is going to be capped with Tempest 26.0.0[1] which use compatible constraint not the master: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/26.0.0/tox.ini#L14

This should not be any issue for py2.7 testing too as Tempest is run in python3 virtual env for py2.7 job also. 

Let's see if 774103 raise any issue, I am sure there should not be any.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/774103"}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-02-05 09:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-02-12 14:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

fixed with a different change'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-21 00:12:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

for legacy job we need this as devstack-gate started setting the different constraints - 

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-gate/+/776722

https://313c151c819bbbc79831-d74c150336b8812da9a5c6ef7516ca18.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/775903/7/check/designate-bind9/8d9ae90/job-output.txt'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-21 00:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-21 01:50:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

this fix is working fine and unblock the designate stable/stein - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate/+/775903'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-04 10:23:36.000000000', 'message': "Allow use custom uppper constraints in stable/stein

Openstack Stein still supports Python 2.7 which means it is necessary to
set different upper constraints for that specific release for tempest
testing using that Python version.
The current master upper constraints won't work as they exclusively
consider Python version >= 3.x

Change-Id: Ieafd0ebc242eba2f4cbaf22823dbe94735236189
"}]
commit_message:
Allow use custom uppper constraints in stable/stein

Openstack Stein still supports Python 2.7 which means it is necessary to
set different upper constraints for that specific release for tempest
testing using that Python version.
The current master upper constraints won't work as they exclusively
consider Python version >= 3.x

Change-Id: Ieafd0ebc242eba2f4cbaf22823dbe94735236189

commit_message:
Add /request endpoint in test_server.bin

Add new endpoint in test_server application:
- /request prints the client request (method, URL, HTTP version and
  headers) in the payload of the reply
  /request can take a "response_code" parameter (ie,
  "/request?response_code=404"), the server replies with the appropriate
  HTTP response code to the client.

Change-Id: Ibc03f62da06a5bbb93959eac865e5f3f14caa50e

subject: Switch the tempest controllers to focal
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-17 18:25:07.000000000', 'message': 'Switch the tempest controllers to focal

Per the Victoria PTI [1], we should be using focal for Ubuntu
jobs.
This patch switches the tempest jobs to use focal instead of bionic.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html

Change-Id: Iea89e4577a0961212e56b111fe65857062eb14f4
'}]
commit_message:
Switch the tempest controllers to focal

Per the Victoria PTI [1], we should be using focal for Ubuntu
jobs.
This patch switches the tempest jobs to use focal instead of bionic.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html

Change-Id: Iea89e4577a0961212e56b111fe65857062eb14f4

commit_message:
Add designate pool uuid to secrets

That UUID is supposed to be generated per deployment
instead of being hardcoded in role defaults

Change-Id: I452d23c650104b8dfe53f3477a3c3ef9c2c62b56

commit_message:
Support to restore backup from data location

This feature needs to bump python-troveclient major version as it
introduced an incompatible change for backup creation CLI.

Change-Id: I6fe94ccb552e2c0020150494ccc2ba6361184229

[{'created': '2021-02-18 13:11:28.000000000', 'message': 'Make content-providers depend on molecule and linters jobs

This makes the content provider jobs across the various templates
standalone/undercloud/multinode depend on openstack-tox-linters
and tripleo-tox-molecule. Part of a wider effort at [1] to improve
tripleo CI efficiency.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: Id70d5724a26abb0042cd8219c68aa194612147a1
'}, {'created': '2021-02-19 13:56:57.000000000', 'message': 'Make content-provider depend on openstack-tox-linters in check

Part of a wider CI optimization at [1] this makes the content
provider job in the check layout depend on openstack-tox-linters.

Also added to the multinode-branchful template since it is used
only in tq/tqe and they both already have the linters job.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: Id70d5724a26abb0042cd8219c68aa194612147a1
'}]
commit_message:
Make content-provider depend on openstack-tox-linters in check

Part of a wider CI optimization at [1] this makes the content
provider job in the check layout depend on openstack-tox-linters.

Also added to the multinode-branchful template since it is used
only in tq/tqe and they both already have the linters job.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: Id70d5724a26abb0042cd8219c68aa194612147a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-12 14:23:06.000000000', 'message': 'Log information about the Ceph v2 clone API

Starting with the Mimic release and the Ceph RBD clone v2 feature,
it is no longer necessary to manage snapshot protection status.
The usage of clone v2 is controlled via the Ceph “rbd default
clone format” configuration option which defaults to “auto”, but
can be overridden to “1” to force the legacy clone v1 behavior or
“2” to force the new clonev2 behavior.

This must be configured in Ceph, it's not something that can be
configured on the Cinder side.

As an alternative, setting the minimum client to mimic
"$ ceph osd set-require-min-compat-client mimic"

Above all with Ceph RBD clone v2 support enabled, image snapshots
can be cloned without marking the snapshot as protected because
RBD automatically tracks the usage of the snapshot by clones. As
a result Ceph RBD clone v2 API improves performance.

This proposed patch adds logging messages for the operator
indicating whether Ceph has been configured to use the Ceph RBD
v2 clone feature.

In this way the operator can consult with the Ceph administrator
to take appropriate action.

You can determine which volumes are using the clone v2 feature
thanks to volume.volume.op_features(). It returns a value depending
on the v2 clone api being enabled or not.

Also includes squash to fix unit test from:
Fix RBD_OPERATION_FEATURE_CLONE_PARENT in unittest
Change-Id: I00cd30f2e7181ea6bf9fccfe9170bee037b4652d

Co-authored-by: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib52879a270a4ae4cdd3cb5fc18f2b7bdbccd8ab5
(cherry picked from commit efd83675780a76422436d47c4622e22a0645cc30)
(cherry picked from commit d5fade7d8c6ade6166946280c7717cff10762d1f)
(cherry picked from commit 71987b305077654fcd3433d6bd7a65cd176279c1)
'}, {'created': '2021-02-12 18:42:04.000000000', 'message': 'Log information about the Ceph v2 clone API

Starting with the Mimic release and the Ceph RBD clone v2 feature,

The usage of clone v2 is controlled via the Ceph “rbd default
clone format” configuration option which defaults to “auto”, but
can be overridden to “1” to force the legacy clone v1 behavior or
“2” to force the new clonev2 behavior.

This must be configured in Ceph, it's not something that can be
configured on the Cinder side.

As an alternative, setting the minimum client to mimic
"$ ceph osd set-require-min-compat-client mimic"

Above all with Ceph RBD clone v2 support enabled, image snapshots
can be cloned without marking the snapshot as protected because
RBD automatically tracks the usage of the snapshot by clones. As
a result Ceph RBD clone v2 API improves performance.

This proposed patch adds logging messages for the operator
indicating whether Ceph has been configured to use the Ceph RBD
v2 clone feature.

In this way the operator can consult with the Ceph administrator
to take appropriate action.

You can determine which volumes are using the clone v2 feature
thanks to volume.volume.op_features(). It returns a value depending
on the v2 clone api being enabled or not.

Also includes squash to fix unit test from:
Fix RBD_OPERATION_FEATURE_CLONE_PARENT in unittest
Change-Id: I00cd30f2e7181ea6bf9fccfe9170bee037b4652d

commit_message:
Log information about the Ceph v2 clone API

Starting with the Mimic release and the Ceph RBD clone v2 feature,
it is no longer necessary to manage snapshot protection status.
The usage of clone v2 is controlled via the Ceph “rbd default
clone format” configuration option which defaults to “auto”, but
can be overridden to “1” to force the legacy clone v1 behavior or
“2” to force the new clonev2 behavior.

This must be configured in Ceph, it's not something that can be
configured on the Cinder side.

As an alternative, setting the minimum client to mimic
"$ ceph osd set-require-min-compat-client mimic"

Above all with Ceph RBD clone v2 support enabled, image snapshots
can be cloned without marking the snapshot as protected because
RBD automatically tracks the usage of the snapshot by clones. As
a result Ceph RBD clone v2 API improves performance.

This proposed patch adds logging messages for the operator
indicating whether Ceph has been configured to use the Ceph RBD
v2 clone feature.

In this way the operator can consult with the Ceph administrator
to take appropriate action.

You can determine which volumes are using the clone v2 feature
thanks to volume.volume.op_features(). It returns a value depending
on the v2 clone api being enabled or not.

Also includes squash to fix unit test from:
Fix RBD_OPERATION_FEATURE_CLONE_PARENT in unittest
Change-Id: I00cd30f2e7181ea6bf9fccfe9170bee037b4652d

Branch-specific changes: the changes to the unit test
cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py have been tuned
to support python2 in train.

Co-authored-by: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib52879a270a4ae4cdd3cb5fc18f2b7bdbccd8ab5
(cherry picked from commit efd83675780a76422436d47c4622e22a0645cc30)
(cherry picked from commit d5fade7d8c6ade6166946280c7717cff10762d1f)
(cherry picked from commit 71987b305077654fcd3433d6bd7a65cd176279c1)

commit_message:
Remove general tht matches from standalone-scenario layout files:

As part of [1] this removes some of the files: matches that are for
general tripleo-heat-templates files - e.g. common/ or environments/*
we don't need to run every scenario for this.

For example see [2] where a change to scen1 and undercloud env causes
job run for scenarios 1,2,3,4,7,12.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce
[2] https://i.imgur.com/ECFPLah.png

Change-Id: I4e95b3298244cf71972ddee13cf2726aabf5cb8e

[{'created': '2021-02-16 15:07:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix DevStack setup on CentOS 8.3

CentOS 8.3 changed the name of the PowerTools repository to powertools.
With the repository disabled, DevStack fails to install libyaml-devel,
which causes a failure to install many packages. In my environment
DevStack stopped with an error caused by a missing wget.

Keep the command using the old repository name, for compatibility with
older CentOS releases.

Change-Id: I5541a8aee8467abf10ce8a10d770618bdd693f02
'}, {'created': '2021-02-17 16:43:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix DevStack setup on CentOS 8.3

CentOS 8.3 changed the name of the PowerTools repository to powertools:
https://wiki.centos.org/Manuals/ReleaseNotes/CentOS8.2011#Yum_repo_file_and_repoid_changes

With this repository disabled, DevStack fails to install libyaml-devel,
which causes a failure to install many packages. In my environment
DevStack stopped with an error caused by a missing wget.

Keep the command using the old repository name, for compatibility with
older CentOS releases.

Change-Id: I5541a8aee8467abf10ce8a10d770618bdd693f02
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DevStack setup on CentOS 8.3

CentOS 8.3 changed the name of the PowerTools repository to powertools:
https://wiki.centos.org/Manuals/ReleaseNotes/CentOS8.2011#Yum_repo_file_and_repoid_changes

With this repository disabled, DevStack fails to install libyaml-devel,
which causes a failure to install many packages. In my environment
DevStack stopped with an error caused by a missing wget.

Keep the command using the old repository name, for compatibility with
older CentOS releases.

Change-Id: I5541a8aee8467abf10ce8a10d770618bdd693f02

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-12 12:30:39.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] rfp interface deleted when router is disabled/enabled

1. When dvr router is disabled and enabled back, the rfp
interfaces are deleted on the nodes without snat-* namespace.
This is due to creation of snat namespace during router
initialization stage on all the nodes. At later stages, since
the gw_port_host is not bounded on this node, external gateway
is removed which triggers removal of rfp interfaces and snat
namespace.
Create snat namespace only on the nodes where gw_port_host is
bounded.

2. In case of DVR SNAT, when the l3 agent is rescheduled to
another node, the rfp interfaces on qrouter-* namespace are
removed. Instead of calling external_gateway_removed(), the
qg-, sg- interfaces need to be unplugged and snat namespace
need to be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1894843
Change-Id: Ic35c2f9bceacec8eeba67a2b1ea0cd0b0ffc72fe

commit_message:
Fix deletion of rfp interfaces when router is re-enabled

1. When dvr router is disabled and enabled back, the rfp
interfaces are deleted on the nodes without snat-* namespace.
This is due to creation of snat namespace during router
initialization stage on all the nodes. At later stages, since
the gw_port_host is not bounded on this node, external gateway
is removed which triggers removal of rfp interfaces and snat
namespace.
Create snat namespace only on the nodes where gw_port_host is
bounded.

2. In case of DVR SNAT, when the l3 agent is rescheduled to
another node, the rfp interfaces on qrouter-* namespace are
removed. Instead of calling external_gateway_removed() which
further deletes the rfp interfaces, the qg-, sg- interfaces
need to be unplugged and snat namespace need to be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1894843
Change-Id: Ic35c2f9bceacec8eeba67a2b1ea0cd0b0ffc72fe

commit_message:
Mark 2.9 ansible-test sanity as non-voting

Current way of running ansible-test with venv is failing because
of cryptography package issue[1]. Mark it non-voting until the
issue is resolved.

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5771

Change-Id: Ife1468c4c7140ed3bdaf1dad06a09c71b8e1dbd4

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-08 12:59:17.000000000', 'message': 'Use zuul provided requirements repo during bootstrap-ansible.sh

This patch automatically detects if the deployment is running in
zuul CI  and uses the locally available git repo to get a copy
of upper-constraints.txt if possible.

A copy of the upper-constraints.txt file is placed in /opt for
all deployments both in and out of CI, and is used as the source
of constraints when creating the ansible runtime venv.

This reduces the need to make requests for the same data to the
opendev.org git servers which will improve CI job reliability.

commit_message:
Use zuul provided requirements repo during bootstrap-ansible.sh

This patch automatically detects if the deployment is running in
zuul CI  and uses the locally available git repo to get a copy
of upper-constraints.txt if possible.

A copy of the upper-constraints.txt file is placed in /opt for
all deployments both in and out of CI, and is used as the source
of constraints when creating the ansible runtime venv.

This reduces the need to make requests for the same data to the
opendev.org git servers which will improve CI job reliability.

Change-Id: Ib5afc1d6b46790f1ae41593f0ce8f8530320472e

An option to deploy non-HA OVN deployment was removed with
change Ia2f50d539bf6afbeb67610a925f9f4ea0849d735, but the
one reference to deleted environment file wasn't removed.

Change-Id: Ibe03f7a284f498b75991947930ee1936c7ee9b0e

commit_message:
Remove reference to OVN non-HA environment file

An option to deploy non-HA OVN deployment was removed with
change Ia2f50d539bf6afbeb67610a925f9f4ea0849d735, but the
one reference to deleted environment file wasn't removed.

This minor change removes the reference to
environment/services/neutron-ovn-dvr.yaml environment file.

Related-bug: #1779123
Change-Id: Ibe03f7a284f498b75991947930ee1936c7ee9b0e

The "API unexpected exception" message was changed to not include
references to launchpad.
The user should follow their cloud provider support.

'}, {'created': '2021-02-16 14:53:13.000000000', 'message': 'Change API unexpected exception message

The "API unexpected exception" message can now be configured
by the cloud provider.

By default it continues to display the "launchpad" webpage to
report the nova bug, but it can be configured by the cloud
provider to point to a custom support page.

commit_message:
Change API unexpected exception message

The "API unexpected exception" message can now be configured
by the cloud provider.

By default it continues to display the "launchpad" webpage to
report the nova bug, but it can be configured by the cloud
provider to point to a custom support page.

Change-Id: Ib262b91b57f832cbcc233f24f15572e1ea6803bd
Closes-Bug: #1810342

We should never use --detached when calling podman create as it
makes no sense and has actually been removed in podman 3 via
https://github.com/containers/podman/commit/15345ce4c3b02389fe172f090549a50b95322753

Any use of that flag when using podman >= 3.x create will error out with:

(cherry picked from commit fa68844b069090f73364988c967d4ad018348c99)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not call --detach when using podman create

We should never use --detached when calling podman create as it
makes no sense and has actually been removed in podman 3 via
https://github.com/containers/podman/commit/15345ce4c3b02389fe172f090549a50b95322753

Any use of that flag when using podman >= 3.x create will error out with:

  Error: unknown flag: --detach

Change-Id: I8356110aba03dcbc09de97633bfe6f03580e2e7a
Closes-Bug: #1915500
(cherry picked from commit fa68844b069090f73364988c967d4ad018348c99)

commit_message:
Allow OCF resources to be created with --force

While moving to running pcs commands on the host and off short-lived
containers, we are confronted with the issue that pcs usually checks
for the resource agent's existence on the host before creating it.
Since we'd rather avoid installing the needed resource agents on the
host (as it is inside a container), we allow a new 'force_ocf' parameter
to be passed to those situations where we might need it.

Depends-On: I20eb78a061a334b20f6b2274591c5d313a0af532
Depends-On: I4bea96767a3246054c5d98271d8378d84fefc247

NB: Small conflicts due to context change in the following files:
  manifests/profile/pacemaker/database/mysql_bundle.pp
  manifests/profile/pacemaker/ovn_dbs_bundle.pp

Related-Bug: #1863442
Change-Id: If9048196b5c03e3cfaba72f043b7f7275568bdc4
(cherry picked from commit d185cbf032e02eec7f051e85c51c19732620e192)
(cherry picked from commit 844975ef4be5e52cd056b7a11a4251ae1ef53ef5)

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: I617dcad7367eb3647a071773de1855ca048ef7bf

commit_message:
Updates to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3

* Update requirements.txt to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3
* Update tox.ini to change the build parameters.
* This upgrades from <2.7 which adds reproducible charms
* Bug was fixed that controlled the default output directory
  doesn't get 'builds' appended.  The tox change puts it
  back so that stable & master both build to the same
  directory.  This may be reviewed in the future.

Change-Id: I99326ee6d47a901bbeb6a186e0a1905ce4374ed2

commit_message:
Stop installing client packages for ansible venv

We delegate openstack client operations to the utility host nowadays,
so no reason to install them into ansible venv.

Change-Id: I4a183598150186f54ef52bef9e10ee915e9b85de

* Update tox.ini to change the build parameters.

commit_message:
Ensure that endpoints are updated when tls config changes

When tls settings change, the endpoints need to be updated on the
identity-service relation in order for keystone to update the service
catalog with the new endpoints. This change follows the behavior of
other reactive charms and performs this update within the handlers
code.

Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza/pull/424
Change-Id: I201fc382f044111e6f28a13c64a55e2f79c1d6aa
Closes-Bug: #1901589

commit_message:
Change case of default member role for Keystone

As a part of the 20.05 charms release, the boostrap process for
Keystone led to changing the case of the member role. This work
was performed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712040/ so this
change is aligning ceph-radosgw with that new default.

Change-Id: I116bb1def1b6bc8c111f30018598673da4dfdb5d
Closes-Bug: #1904183

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-08 10:12:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix amphora image build

DIB dropped Python 2 support in its version 3.0.0 major release and as
so we had to pin it to 2.30.0 in stable/stein and stable/train branches.
However, upstream get-pip.sh recently introduced a regression where it
does not work well with Python 2. Sadly, DIB 2.30.0 points to master
get-pip.sh [1] and DIB is branchless so the fix cannot be backported and
we are in a deadlock scenario where Python 2 amphora images can't be
built.

To work-around this issue on Stein and Train releases, we have to make a
compromise: either build amphora images using master DIB and Python 3
only or be stuck (unless someone else can come up with another approach,
all ears). Ussuri and newer releases are not impacted by this issue as
they are Python 3 only releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/772254

Change-Id: I13da9a49ace803e957dc52e4882b78141bc7bef3
"}, {'created': '2021-02-08 14:28:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix amphora image build

get-pip.sh [1] and DIB is branchless so the fix cannot be backported and

compromise: either build amphora images using master DIB and Python 3
only or be stuck (unless someone else can come up with another approach,
all ears). Ussuri and newer releases are not impacted by this issue as
they are Python 3 only releases.

This patch also fixes octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario jobs that were running on
Ubuntu Xenial but should be on Bionic.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/772254

Change-Id: I13da9a49ace803e957dc52e4882b78141bc7bef3

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/772254

Change-Id: I13da9a49ace803e957dc52e4882b78141bc7bef3
"}, {'created': '2021-02-10 10:01:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix amphora image build

DIB dropped Python 2 support in its version 3.0.0 major release and as
so we had to pin it to 2.30.0 in stable/stein and stable/train branches.
However, upstream get-pip.sh recently introduced a regression where it
does not work well with Python <= 3.5. Sadly, DIB 2.30.0 points to
master get-pip.sh [1] and DIB is branchless so the fix cannot be
backported and we are in a deadlock scenario where Python <= 3.5 amphora
images can't be built.

To work-around this issue on Stein and Train releases, we have to make a
compromise: either build amphora images using master DIB and Python
>=3.6 only or be stuck (unless someone else can come up with another
approach, all ears). Ussuri and newer releases are not impacted by this
issue as they are Python >=3.6 only releases.

Additionally, in the process of fixing Stein CI jobs we noticed that
octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario jobs were still running on Ubuntu Xenial
(Python 3.5!) but should have been on Bionic. The nodeset was updated to
Bionic-based but yet they continued to fail. For unknown reasons, Zuul
didn't collect CI log files so we couldn't troubleshoot the issue
further (infra team was pinged on IRC, no response). Given that Stein is
in extended maintenance and these jobs are neutron-lbaas (EOLd), we have
reasons to believe there is no one interested in maintaining these jobs
to the level worth keeping them as voting.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/772254

Change-Id: I13da9a49ace803e957dc52e4882b78141bc7bef3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix amphora image build

DIB dropped Python 2 support in its version 3.0.0 major release and as
so we had to pin it to 2.30.0 in stable/stein and stable/train branches.
However, upstream get-pip.sh recently introduced a regression where it
does not work well with Python <= 3.5. Sadly, DIB 2.30.0 points to
master get-pip.sh [1] and DIB is branchless so the fix cannot be
backported and we are in a deadlock scenario where Python <= 3.5 amphora
images can't be built.

To work-around this issue on Stein and Train releases, we have to make a
compromise: either build amphora images using master DIB and Python
>=3.6 only or be stuck (unless someone else can come up with another
approach, all ears). Ussuri and newer releases are not impacted by this
issue as they are Python >=3.6 only releases.

Additionally, in the process of fixing Stein CI jobs we noticed that
octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario jobs were still running on Ubuntu Xenial
(Python 3.5!) but should have been on Bionic. The nodeset was updated to
Bionic-based but yet they continued to fail. For unknown reasons, Zuul
didn't collect CI log files so we couldn't troubleshoot the issue
further (infra team was pinged on IRC, no response). Given that Stein is
in extended maintenance and these jobs are neutron-lbaas (EOLd), we have
reasons to believe there is no one interested in maintaining these jobs
to the level worth keeping them as voting.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/772254

Change-Id: I13da9a49ace803e957dc52e4882b78141bc7bef3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-03 20:20:06.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Only ask tpool.Proxy to autowrap vir* classes

I668643c836d46a25df46d4c99a973af5e50a39db attempted to fix service wide
pauses by providing a more complete list of classes to tpool.Proxy.

While this excluded libvirtError it can include internal libvirt-python
classes pointed to by private globals that have been introduced with the
use of type checking within the module.

Any attempt to wrap these internal classes will result in the failure
seen in bug #1901383. As a result this change simply ignores any class
found during inspection that doesn't start with the `vir` string, used
by libvirt to denote public methods and classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901383
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I568b0c4fd6069b9118ff116532f14abb46cc42ab
(cherry picked from commit 0d2ca53bb86b8e4a3c44855cb5ef57f223462543)
(cherry picked from commit 048a3337a8c98ec8fc138083376430ffb9027f67)
(cherry picked from commit 36cb57d97be07a5560bef4c090f8cab47992c042)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Only ask tpool.Proxy to autowrap vir* classes

I668643c836d46a25df46d4c99a973af5e50a39db attempted to fix service wide
pauses by providing a more complete list of classes to tpool.Proxy.

While this excluded libvirtError it can include internal libvirt-python
classes pointed to by private globals that have been introduced with the
use of type checking within the module.

Any attempt to wrap these internal classes will result in the failure
seen in bug #1901383. As a result this change simply ignores any class
found during inspection that doesn't start with the `vir` string, used
by libvirt to denote public methods and classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901383
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I568b0c4fd6069b9118ff116532f14abb46cc42ab
(cherry picked from commit 0d2ca53bb86b8e4a3c44855cb5ef57f223462543)
(cherry picked from commit 048a3337a8c98ec8fc138083376430ffb9027f67)

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/758918/9/iscsi : FAILURE in 54m 14s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-02-19 10:20:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Thinking about this again I'm on the fence about this needing a microversion and would ask other cores to chime in with their thoughts. This is a API behaviour change but a corrective change to avert potential issues if the current task hasn't taken an instance.uuid lock on the compute, allowing the attach to proceed while another action is in progress. 

This change would also block users from queuing attach, detach and swap requests behind the instance.uuid lock on the compute when the running task had already taken it. I can't think why users would rely on that behaviour but they could unknowingly be doing that by firing off requests without polling on state changes etc.

Regardless, you need to call out and test the changes to swap_volume. Additional functional tests would also be useful to prove out this new behaviour for these APIs. I'm happy to help write the documentation updates and releasenote if you would like if you can sort the tests out?"}, {'account_id': 31827, 'date': '2021-02-20 01:37:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

> 
> This change would also block users from queuing attach, detach and swap requests behind the instance.uuid lock on the compute when the running task had already taken it. I can't think why users would rely on that behaviour but they could unknowingly be doing that by firing off requests without polling on state changes etc.
> 
> Regardless, you need to call out and test the changes to swap_volume. Additional functional tests would also be useful to prove out this new behaviour for these APIs. I'm happy to help write the documentation updates and releasenote if you would like if you can sort the tests out?

I am very glad and appreciate if you help to write the documentation updates and releasenote"}, {'account_id': 31827, 'date': '2021-02-20 01:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-02-20 01:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Reject to attach and detach volume while task_state is not None

There is no restriction for attach and detach volumes while the instance's
task_state is not None, like rebuiding, migrating etc. And in this case,
it will be conflicting.

Related-Bug: #1897424

Part of blueprint ensure-volume-attachment-successful

Change-Id: I2c07f5e47ee890460aa68d901d35c7eff9abe242

commit_message:
Document on renaming Chinese locales in horizon

There is no good place to document Chinese locale rename
in horizon and plugins, so this commit add contents to
"Handling horizon projects" section in tools.rst and add the info
on Chinese locales to the section.

Change-Id: I3e9d2398e3768b9d479d01aa2ac73f8d72bdcb8f

subject: Add py38 package metadata
messages:
[{'account_id': 31027, 'date': '2021-01-03 02:51:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-01-25 20:59:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am personally not sure why setup.cfg is required as the i18n repo does not ship any PyPI compatible python codes.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2021-02-20 05:23:19.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Although the patch is not harmful, it would be great if: 1) add topic, blueprint, and/or related article to describe more 2) describe why it is helpful for i18n repo especially. I am happy to move forward if it is enhanced. Since the original patch submitter doesn't reply from last comment from @amotoki, I want to set as abandoned, but feel free to re-initiate this patch by addressing my points hopefully."}]

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Wallaby tests that include a
voting py38 job from victoria release, we can now add the
Python 3.8 metadata to the package information to reflect
that support.

Change-Id: I329d1cc4dd94f3148afa8402cf8905c99d6414ce

commit_message:
Added libvirt_packages for fedora support

Had to add libvirt_packages, virtualbmc_packages, and ansible_pkg_mgr
to fix the virtual environment for reproducer running on Fedora
platform.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3ac6ac5cd793828d233bc71e6dec49012ee28b7c

[{'created': '2020-11-13 01:07:25.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ibd54d94807677b2eaafb5e9c6f26c4cff9d27730
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ibd54d94807677b2eaafb5e9c6f26c4cff9d27730

subject: HPE: Add Peer Persistence support for Primera backend

commit_message:
HPE: Add Peer Persistence support for Primera backend

Last year, code changes were done to add Peer Persistence
support for the HPE 3PAR backend.
Change details: I2d0342adace69314bd159d3d6415a87ff29db562
The same code changes work for the newer HPE Primera backend.
This patch updates the documentation.

Change-Id: I0df55ee5548caa6f37522253ffa6f081000c78bb

commit_message:
Specify OVN driver_agent for Victoria+

In Ussuri the ovn driver agent appears to have been included in
the wsgi app server. In victoria it has been moved out and needs
to be specified as a driver agent so it is started correctly.

Please note that although the docs refer to an amphora agent
it does not seem to exist and is not listed in octavia
entry points *1

*1 https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/src/branch/stable/victoria/setup.cfg#L73

Closes-Bug: #1915830
Change-Id: I09dc3527bd19997ecd68ebe58acb4ddc727d9759

I was looking to see if KA had support planned for OIDC, so I was very happy to see so much work already done and in a pretty mature state! Thanks Pedro. I'm not a core reviewer, but left some comments as a future consumer of this feature :)

From a security perspective it always weirds me out to see `eval(user_defined_var)`. I wonder if there is a way around that. I don't have a lot of experience with OIDC providers so I'm not aware of all the edge cases that necessitate such a super-powered solution."}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-04-15 21:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-04-15 21:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(1 comment)

Hello Jason, thanks for the review.

Answering some of your questions.

Q: What is the reason for listing these separately from identity_providers, given that each identity_provider can only support one mapping?

A: This approach was used due to Keystone registers both Identity Providers and attribute mappings separately; one mapping can be used by multiple IdPs. 

Q: I don't see organization_domain_name used anywhere, is that hiding somewhere?

A: You are right, the "organization_domain_name" is not in use yet, but it will be used for the discovery phase when authenticating in Horizon via federation, so when the user enters her/his domain e-mail or the domain name he/she desires to be authenticated in, Horizon will know the correct Identity Provider to redirect the user. This attribute will be used in the next PRs after this one is merged in.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-05-18 12:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-05-18 12:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Review-Priority-1

feature freeze (this does not mean the patch is bad, just that we are postponing reviews)'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-05-18 17:24:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-05-23 08:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: -Review-Priority

ussuri branched, unfreezing'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-02 15:10:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: Code-Review-1

we had a little chat on this change during ptg - my stance is that we really don't need this script file - it would be better to have this config sourced statically"}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-06-02 15:14:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

> we had a little chat on this change during ptg - my stance is that
 > we really don't need this script file - it would be better to have
 > this config sourced statically

What configuration are you talking about? If you mean only the configuration that is added to the Keystone WSGI, that does not scale. For instance, when adding IdPs in runtime. Moreover, we have all of these different configurations in different systems (Keystone, and horizon). Even though these are different systems, the configs are dependent on each other. Therefore, the Kolla-ansible seemed the natural place to centralize it."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-02 15:19:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

> > we had a little chat on this change during ptg - my stance is
 > that
 > > we really don't need this script file - it would be better to

 > What configuration are you talking about? If you mean only the
 > configuration that is added to the Keystone WSGI, that does not
 > scale. For instance, when adding IdPs in runtime. Moreover, we have
 > all of these different configurations in different systems
 > (Keystone, and horizon). Even though these are different systems,
 > the configs are dependent on each other. Therefore, the
 > Kolla-ansible seemed the natural place to centralize it.

I'm talking about what the .py.j2 file is doing - downloading metadata from the IdP, it should not really be done this way IMHO."}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-06-05 21:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-06-06 01:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-06-16 20:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Code-Review+1

Radek,
Pedro has updated the patch. Can you check if this current implementation satisfy the changes that you requested?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-17 19:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Code-Review-1 -Review-Priority

(3 comments)

> Radek,
 > Pedro has updated the patch. Can you check if this current
 > implementation satisfy the changes that you requested?

Thanks, Pedro and Rafael. The docs look especially well! Just some easy comments around. We will also need a release note for this new feature.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-06-17 21:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 29100, 'date': '2020-06-17 22:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 29100, 'date': '2020-06-17 22:42:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

I hope it's not too late to contribute some changes I had to this original patchset, and that it's not going to cause problems with review--I had talked to Pedro out-of-band about contributing some things, namely:

- Clean up a lot of the 'when' logic so it's easier to control
- Fix issue where multiple OIDC groups couldn't be mapped b/c by default the separator Keystone's mapper wants is a semicolon
- Fix some CentOS specific path/user issues
- Fix issue where, if Horizon was set up to use internal endpoints, WebSSO wouldn't work.

This is a great change, thanks Pedro and Rafael!"}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-06-17 23:18:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: Code-Review+1

> I hope it's not too late to contribute some changes I had to this
 > original patchset, and that it's not going to cause problems with
 > review--I had talked to Pedro out-of-band about contributing some
 > things, namely:
 > 
 > - Clean up a lot of the 'when' logic so it's easier to control
 > - Fix issue where multiple OIDC groups couldn't be mapped b/c by
 > default the separator Keystone's mapper wants is a semicolon
 > - Fix some CentOS specific path/user issues
 > - Fix issue where, if Horizon was set up to use internal endpoints,
 > WebSSO wouldn't work.
 > 
 > This is a great change, thanks Pedro and Rafael!

Thanks for the awesome improvement!

I guess we were a bit too used with the code, and we were missing all of these improvements points. Just to tell you the history, I implemented this initially in rocky (internally), and Pedro helped me to port forward the changes, and push it upstream.

Again, awesome job!

I hope we can interact more concerning identity federation support in OpenStack. We have more extensions and implementations coming in the near feature."}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-06-18 12:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-06-18 13:46:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-06-18 13:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-06-18 16:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-18 17:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: -Review-Priority

From PTG:

How do we get this over the line in Wallaby?
It's a large, complex patch, requiring deep knowledge to review
How can we make reviewers confident enough to approve?
It should be disabled by default, and will hopefully not affect other environments +1
We may be open to merging as experimental and evolving it over time +1
Can we test it in CI? +1
* OIDC yes
* SAML2 probably not
Can we document a simple setup in a development environment? +1"}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2020-11-20 13:08:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 39.'}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2020-12-04 09:09:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 39:

Hi Rafael! As discussed on IRC Channel, we should integrate both OIDC and SAML2 authentication, either on two patches or on the same one, however, if we choose to split that in two patches we should sync about the variables that we need to introduce.

On a side note, we also need for both (OIDC/SAML2) to push a change on HAPROXY services.d configuration in order to introduce sticky sessions (cookie) or sticky tables in order to avoid 401 Unauthorized response when dealing with multinode installation.

I've used the simple cookie LBSESSIONID strategy on my own by sticky tables allows for a peering between members of the HAPRoxy cluster and so is more robust when dealing with a Active/Active HAPRoxy cluster."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-12-04 09:54:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 39:

> 
> I've used the simple cookie LBSESSIONID strategy on my own by sticky tables allows for a peering between members of the HAPRoxy cluster and so is more robust when dealing with a Active/Active HAPRoxy cluster.

I propose to split out the common parts and work together, I also had some lined up change for SAML2."}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-12-04 12:44:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 39:

It's nowhere near self contained,
Haproxy part can be just a change to set balance source mode, or even improved to allow setting a cookie per server to balance on (balance source is not really optimal)
Keystone can be split at least into two (support identity providers + oidc specific configuration)
Currently if you don't know how federation works and what needs to be configured in depth - you're unable to review it in whole.
It's easy to submit this in patch series and get each patch reviewed/merged - then asking somebody to commit hours of review and testing on his own environment.
It's just a too big chunk - and please rethink how to test this in a CI (the oidc part)."}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-12-04 15:23:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 40:

Hello guys, can we get some feedback on this one.

During the PTG meeting, we agreed that what this one was missing was a detailed documentation on how to test it. We created this documentation showing how one can get and IdP up and running, and then how to configure it to use this patch.

If it is unit tests that this one is missing, we can create a test to validate if the configurations files generated by Kolla-ansible have the content we expect them to have.

We would like to get some clear guidelines on what is missing here.'}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2020-12-22 15:01:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

Hi rafael, I think this isn't moving because of the holidays periods.

Regarding the documentation, it's fine for me.
Regarding the tests, I think it's not about the SSO Endpoint (keycloak/other) but rather how do we test it on the Kolla CI part of it.

From my own works on SAML2 option, I suggest we create two globals.yml variables.

One that actually activate the federation feature depending on the option you want example:

# Option can either be "saml2" or "oidc" and default to no federation activated.
enable_keystone_federation: saml2

The second variable should be the iDP remote ID:
# This have to be the entityID provided by your identity provider and MUST be a URI
keystone_federation_idp_entityID: "https://sts.acme.net/"

Additionally, when keystone federation is enabled using saml2 and that we found out the mapping.json file under the /config/keystone/ folder, we use it to provision the default idp mapping rules.

Anyway, these are my two cents regarding this federation feature, I don't have any opinion on either or not it should be split away on two patch set tho and regarding OIDC on its own, I think the only things that should be reviewed is the keystone wsgi apache config and the mellon URL endpoint that should be generic and not OIDC or SAML2 oriented as it is for now.

Thanks a lot!
Flint'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-12-29 16:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 41:
> 
> Hi rafael, I think this isn't moving because of the holidays periods.

> Regarding the tests, I think it's not about the SSO Endpoint (keycloak/other) but rather how do we test it on the Kolla CI part of it.
>

> 
> One that actually activate the federation feature depending on the option you want example:
> 
> # Option can either be "saml2" or "oidc" and default to no federation activated.
> enable_keystone_federation: saml2
> 
> The second variable should be the iDP remote ID:
> # This have to be the entityID provided by your identity provider and MUST be a URI
> keystone_federation_idp_entityID: "https://sts.acme.net/"
> 
> Additionally, when keystone federation is enabled using saml2 and that we found out the mapping.json file under the /config/keystone/ folder, we use it to provision the default idp mapping rules.
> 
> Anyway, these are my two cents regarding this federation feature, I don't have any opinion on either or not it should be split away on two patch set tho and regarding OIDC on its own, I think the only things that should be reviewed is the keystone wsgi apache config and the mellon URL endpoint that should be generic and not OIDC or SAML2 oriented as it is for now.
> 
> Thanks a lot!
> Flint

I see. Thanks for the reply.

I do not think that we need other variables. We already defined a `keystone_identity_providers` list of objects, where there exists a `protocol` and `identifier` fields. Therefore, you have everything to add SAMLs information there as well.

The same for the IdP mapping, there is an `attribute_mapping` field that can be used for that. Then, the attribute mappings are defined in the `keystone_identity_mappings`.

And then, for the protected URLs in WSGI file, so far this patch is only adding the OpenID Connect. However, it would be quite easy to change that to use the `protocol` field there as well.

For the testing part, we could execute Kolla-ansible to generate the config files, and then we can inspect and check if the config files (e.g. WSGI keystone file) have the content we expect them to have. What do you guys think? We do not think that we need to set everything up to get a full blown system. We only need to check if the configs are generated as we programmed them to be.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-12-29 16:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

What I propose as a way forward is for us to finish reviewing this patch and merge with OIDC support as experimental, with the understanding that we may make changes to the configuration variables to more cleanly support SAML. We will keep the authors involved in any proposed changes.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-06 10:40:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 42:

It failed: https://041b7cae8b96773398bd-e765881c248de8d2cac9a744a80e425c.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/769765/1/check/kolla-ansible-centos8-source/f8f7688/primary/logs/ansible/deploy'}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-01-07 18:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45:

(1 comment)

Regarding HAProxy and horizon/keystone loadbalance sticky sessions, it would also require to modify this line: 

https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/src/branch/master/ansible/roles/haproxy-config/templates/haproxy_single_service_split.cfg.j2#L96

To add the cookie directive as "balance [source/roundrobin]" isn't enough.

And it would also require to add the cookie directive itself within the frontend_http_extra variable.

All in all the configuration file should look like this:

```
frontend <frontend_name>
  bind <host_fqdn_or_ip>:80
  default_backend <backend_name>

backend backend_name
  balance roundrobin
  cookie <LBSESSIONID> insert indirect nocache
  server <host_sn> <host_fqdn_or_ip>:80 check cookie <host_fqdn_or_UUID> <-- this is especially important.

```

As stated, we should also use the roundrobin balance option over the source one as it's affinity over persistency and balancing traffic should use persistency that guarantee the session road over affinity that indeed don't guarantee the session path as it's implemented as a ("MAY" redirect you) within HAProxy.'}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-01-07 18:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45:

> Patch Set 49: Code-Review-1
> 
> Just to be clear, the test job is still failing: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/769765

Hi Mark, there is a problem with the attribute-mapping the job is using, it is invalid (an empty file is not valid to the attribute mappings in OpenStack)

A touch is not enough to create the mappings:

    - name: ensure keystone federation config exists
      file:
        path: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/keystone-federation/{{ item }}"
        state: touch
      with_items:
        - rules.json
        - cert.pem
        - metadata
        - metadata/x.client
        - metadata/x.conf
        - metadata/x.provider

Here is an example of a valid attribute mapping:

[
    {
        "local": [
            {
                "user": {
                    "name": "{0}",
                    "email": "{1}",
                    "domain": {
                        "name": "{2}"
                    }

                },
                "domain": {
                        "name": "{2}"
                    },
                "projects": [
                    {
                        "name": "{3}",
                        "roles": [
                            {
                                "name": "member"
                            }
                        ]
                    }
                ]
            }
        ],
        "remote": [
            {
                "type": "OIDC-preferred_username"
            },
            {
                "type": "OIDC-email"
            },
            {
                "type": "OIDC-openstack-user-domain"
            },
            {
                "type": "OIDC-openstack-default-project"
            }
        ]
    }
]

It seems that, now, the error is in the configurations used by kolla-ansible, and not in the kollla-ansible code itself'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-25 15:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 49: -Code-Review

One thing I noticed - if you use a domain that doesn't exist, it fails. Should we create the domain?"}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2021-01-28 11:52:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 49:

> Patch Set 49:
> 
> One thing I noticed - if you use a domain that doesn't exist, it fails. Should we create the domain?

Hi Mark,

The domain should be created before configuring the identity providers, this ensure that who configured the identity providers knows exactly what he/she desires. 

Also, this avoid creating wrong domains due typos in the configurations or using the wrong domain, like the case we have a domain called 'my_domain', then in the configuration we type 'my-domain', then a new domain is created with no projects, then I log in the OpenStack through the IdP and no projects are available but it should, then I will lost some time to discover that I was using the wrong domain and the kolla created a new one to me."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-28 12:20:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 49:

(4 comments)

I tried to follow the guides but could not get it working. I had no GUI on the machine so was using SSH forwarding to access keycloak and horizon. This seemed to hit a wall when the IPs didn't line up.

I guess the answer is to install a graphical environment, or setup TLS for keycloak to allow it to use a non localhost IP."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-28 12:26:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 49:

That does mean you need to execute multiple deploys, which is a bit of a pain if you are trying to bootstrap a cloud."}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2021-02-01 21:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 50.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2021-02-01 21:07:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 49:

There is an email thread started outside of Gerrit. I will reply here, since hopefully the recipients will get this, and Gerrit provides more context and history. It's possible that the mentioned lost comments were made via email, in which case they would not show up in Gerrit.

I'd like to state that in my mind, this change is very close. While the recent 50 comment review was a surprise, on closer inspection it is mostly around the docs.

The main sticking point that I can see is the HAProxy session stickiness. If possible, let's discuss that at the IRC meeting on Wednesday. If there are other blocking issues that people have, that would be a good place to discuss them and come to an agreement."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-15 11:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 56:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-15 11:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 56:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2021-02-15 19:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 57.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2021-02-15 20:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57:

(48 comments)

Hi Mark and Radek, thanks for the review, I tried to attend to all your suggestions, sorry if I miss something, and thanks again :)'}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-02-15 20:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57:

(2 comments)

Hi! Here are some comments regarding the sessions.

TBN: It’s not because your balance algorithm is set to leastconn or roundrobin that your session won’t stick, it’s all about the cookies and the optional hash-type directive.

HAProxy doc itself state for:
“ The only thing you have to know is that source IP affinity is the latest method to use when you want to « stick » a user to a server. ”

I know that you need to stick your authentication request as everything is initiated client side (We have the same requirements with SAML2), the issue here is the balance algorithm used.

Otherwise it looks good to me :-)'}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-02-15 20:47:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57:

(1 comment)

Fix typo/mistake on comment.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-16 11:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-02-16 12:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-17 15:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2021-02-17 17:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57:

Just a summary for the discussion we had today in the Kolla IRC meeting (http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-kolla/%23openstack-kolla.2021-02-17.log.html). The sticky session is mandatory to use with the MOD-OIDC that Keystone uses. Therefore, there is only a matter of discussion on the type of sticky session. Currently, it is being proposed "balance-source", which is based on remote IP, which can be a problem if there are many users behind the same IP. However, we already have the same situation with Horizon.

The plan, as we discussed, is to keep the current patch with balance source. Then, we switch to another method for horizon and keystone together, as a .follow-up

We will be waiting for your final considerations (other than the balance mode) on this patch, so we can try to merge it in the coming week.'}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-02-17 18:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57:

> Patch Set 57:
> 
> Just a summary for the discussion we had today in the Kolla IRC meeting (http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-kolla/%23openstack-kolla.2021-02-17.log.html). The sticky session is mandatory to use with the MOD-OIDC that Keystone uses. Therefore, there is only a matter of discussion on the type of sticky session. Currently, it is being proposed "balance-source", which is based on remote IP, which can be a problem if there are many users behind the same IP. However, we already have the same situation with Horizon.
> 
> The plan, as we discussed, is to keep the current patch with balance source. Then, we switch to another method for horizon and keystone together, as a .follow-up
> 
> We will be waiting for your final considerations (other than the balance mode) on this patch, so we can try to merge it in the coming week.

Sounds like a plan we can all agree upon!
I’ll try it later on this week.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-19 15:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-19 16:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Great work and collaboration, thanks to everyone who contributed.

Please follow up to remove the dashes and keep Radek happy!'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-19 16:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57:

Agreed. Work so great that I was not afraid to +2 despite the dashes. 😄'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-19 18:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 57:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-21 13:35:45.000000000', 'message': "Add suport to OpenID Connect Authentication flow

This pull request adds support for the OpenID Connect authentication
flow in Keystone and enables both ID and access token authentication
flows. The ID token configuration is designed to allow users to
authenticate via Horizon using an identity federation; whereas the
Access token is used to allow users to authenticate in the OpenStack CLI
using a federated user.

Without this PR, if one wants to configure OpenStack to use identity
federation, he/she needs to do a lot of configurations in the keystone,
Horizon, and register quite a good number of different parameters using
the CLI such as mappings, identity providers, federated protocols, and
so on. Therefore, with this PR, we propose a method for operators to
introduce/present the IdP's metadata to Kolla-ansible, and based on the
presented metadata, Kolla-ansible takes care of all of the
configurations to prepare OpenStack to work in a federated environment.

Change-Id: I0203a3470d7f8f2a54d5e126d947f540d93b8210

the CLI such as mappings, identity providers, federated protocols, and
so on. Therefore, with this PR, we propose a method for operators to

presented metadata, Kolla-ansible takes care of all of the

Change-Id: I0203a3470d7f8f2a54d5e126d947f540d93b8210
"}, {'created': '2020-06-17 21:22:00.000000000', 'message': "Add suport to OpenID Connect Authentication flow

This pull request adds support for the OpenID Connect authentication
flow in Keystone and enables both ID and access token authentication
flows. The ID token configuration is designed to allow users to
authenticate via Horizon using an identity federation; whereas the
Access token is used to allow users to authenticate in the OpenStack CLI
using a federated user.

Without this PR, if one wants to configure OpenStack to use identity
federation, he/she needs to do a lot of configurations in the keystone,
Horizon, and register quite a good number of different parameters using
the CLI such as mappings, identity providers, federated protocols, and
so on. Therefore, with this PR, we propose a method for operators to
introduce/present the IdP's metadata to Kolla-ansible, and based on the
presented metadata, Kolla-ansible takes care of all of the
configurations to prepare OpenStack to work in a federated environment.

Implements: blueprint add-openid-support
Change-Id: I0203a3470d7f8f2a54d5e126d947f540d93b8210

commit_message:
Add support to OpenID Connect Authentication flow

This pull request adds support for the OpenID Connect authentication
flow in Keystone and enables both ID and access token authentication
flows. The ID token configuration is designed to allow users to
authenticate via Horizon using an identity federation; whereas the
Access token is used to allow users to authenticate in the OpenStack CLI
using a federated user.

Without this PR, if one wants to configure OpenStack to use identity
federation, he/she needs to do a lot of configurations in the keystone,
Horizon, and register quite a good number of different parameters using
the CLI such as mappings, identity providers, federated protocols, and
so on. Therefore, with this PR, we propose a method for operators to
introduce/present the IdP's metadata to Kolla-ansible, and based on the
presented metadata, Kolla-ansible takes care of all of the
configurations to prepare OpenStack to work in a federated environment.

Implements: blueprint add-openid-support
Co-Authored-By: Jason Anderson <jasonanderson@uchicago.edu>
Change-Id: I0203a3470d7f8f2a54d5e126d947f540d93b8210

'}, {'created': '2021-02-08 10:14:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix amphora image build

DIB dropped Python 2 support in its version 3.0.0 major release and as
so we had to pin it to 2.30.0 in stable/stein and stable/train branches.
However, upstream get-pip.sh recently introduced a regression where it
does not work well with Python 2. Sadly, DIB 2.30.0 points to master
get-pip.sh [1] and DIB is branchless so the fix cannot be backported and
we are in a deadlock scenario where Python 2 amphora images can't be
built.

To work-around this issue on Stein and Train releases, we have to make a
compromise: either build amphora images using master DIB and Python 3
only or be stuck (unless someone else can come up with another approach,
all ears). Ussuri and newer releases are not impacted by this issue as
they are Python 3 only releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/772254

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia/+/774426
Change-Id: I13da9a49ace803e957dc52e4882b78141bc7bef3
(cherry picked from commit c7f7b04a1005fc05f23734b38ca0f4b68afa234e)
"}, {'created': '2021-02-19 18:24:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix amphora image build

DIB dropped Python 2 support in its version 3.0.0 major release and as
so we had to pin it to 2.30.0 in stable/stein and stable/train branches.
However, upstream get-pip.sh recently introduced a regression where it
does not work well with Python <-3.5. Sadly, DIB 2.30.0 points to master
get-pip.sh [1] and DIB is branchless so the fix cannot be backported and
we are in a deadlock scenario where Python <=3.5 amphora images can't be
built.

To work-around this issue on stable/train, we have to make a compromise:
either build amphora images using master DIB and Python 3 only or be
stuck (unless someone else can come up with another approach, all ears).
Ussuri and newer releases are not impacted by this issue as they are
Python >=3.6 only releases.

The same issue also applies to Stein and that has an impact on the
octavia-grenade CI job in stable/train. Since Stein Octavia is EOL [2],
we no longer have to test upgrades.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/772254
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/772847

Change-Id: I13da9a49ace803e957dc52e4882b78141bc7bef3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix amphora image build

DIB dropped Python 2 support in its version 3.0.0 major release and as
so we had to pin it to 2.30.0 in stable/stein and stable/train branches.
However, upstream get-pip.sh recently introduced a regression where it
does not work well with Python <-3.5. Sadly, DIB 2.30.0 points to master
get-pip.sh [1] and DIB is branchless so the fix cannot be backported and
we are in a deadlock scenario where Python <=3.5 amphora images can't be
built.

To work-around this issue on stable/train, we have to make a compromise:
either build amphora images using master DIB and Python 3 only or be
stuck (unless someone else can come up with another approach, all ears).
Ussuri and newer releases are not impacted by this issue as they are
Python >=3.6 only releases.

The same issue also applies to Stein and that has an impact on the
octavia-grenade CI job in stable/train. Since Stein Octavia is EOL [2],
we no longer have to test upgrades.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/772254
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/772847

Change-Id: I13da9a49ace803e957dc52e4882b78141bc7bef3

commit_message:
Run glance functional job on glance_store

This will let us see if a proposed patch against glance_store will
break glance's functional job. We already run a tempest job against
glance_store so we should be loosely covered there already.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/776369
Change-Id: Icf96eb49d560f2deb543232435094b34934b9406

the main comment is well you did not update your commenst in the test

more or less the logic of your functest make sense if i asusme the comments

as a general tougth i would split up the current monolithic tests in to several smaller ones
to make debuging them simpler if they fail.

e.g. 
 a test to assert the vaule is recored when not in the image

 a test to assert hard reboot logic with config change

[{'created': '2020-12-17 13:14:00.000000000', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Record the machine_type of instances during init_host

Change-Id: I30c780a7729f1e7d791256bdc38d73b976c56268
'}, {'created': '2021-01-06 14:42:25.000000000', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Record the machine_type of instances in system_metadata

This change starts to record the machine type of instances registered on
a given host during init_host within the system_metadata of the instance.

Where possible the underlying domain is probed to determine the machine
type being used. Note this will return a versioned machine type
associated with the version of QEMU used when launching the instance and
not the generic name of the machine type often used in image metadata or
the underlying driver config.

When an underlying domain is not present, such as when the instance has
been shelved but not yet offloaded the machine type is determined from
the image metadata and host libvirt driver config.

The recorded machine type is then used when next spawning the instance.
If one is not provided in the system metadata then the value is again
determined by looking at the image metadata associated with the instance
and host libvirt driver config.

The recorded machine type is unset when rebuilding the instance as the
new type should always come from the image metadata or host libvirt
driver config during a rebuild.

Change-Id: I30c780a7729f1e7d791256bdc38d73b976c56268

under the ``image_hw_machine_type`` key as already used to store the
image metadata property ``hw_machine_type``. As a result no changes are
