commit_message:
libvirt: Record the machine_type of instances in system_metadata

This change starts to record the machine type of instances registered on
a given host during init_host or later in _configure_guest_by_virt_type
when spawning a new instance.

The machine type is recorded in the system metadata of the instance
under the ``image_hw_machine_type`` key as already used to store the
image metadata property ``hw_machine_type``. As a result no changes are
required to the code of libvirt_utils.get_machine_type that looks up the
machine type of an instance based on it's image metadata and host
config.

Functional tests are included to verify the basic behaviour of both this
new registration code and now this leads to instances being effectively
pinned to the machine type used during their initial spawn.

blueprint: libvirt-default-machine-type
Change-Id: I30c780a7729f1e7d791256bdc38d73b976c56268

commit_message:
Drop base grenade job for nova

The grenade multinode job that nova runs is a superset of the base
grenade job. There is really no reason for us to run both, and doing
so consumes a lot of resources for no real gain.

Change-Id: If2608406776e0d5a06b726e65b55881e70562d18

commit_message:
tox mypy: Call mypywrap.sh directly

Tox issues a warning because bash is not
in whitelist_externals and indicates that this
will fail in tox 4+.

Just call mypywrap.sh directly to prevent this.

Change-Id: I3c1747b255338d189806b331ae6a3c1b37e6d744

subject: [OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID
messages:
[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-02-16 10:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-02-16 10:37:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/775795/1 : FAILURE in 13m 03s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-02-16 17:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

I can reproduce the issue without the patch. Without removing the conntrack flow, the traffic is not recovered and the entry persists [1] with mark=1 (invalid).

With the patch, when the SG rule is re-applied, the conntrack flow is removed and the OVS creates a new one, with mark=0 [2].

[1]http://paste.openstack.org/show/802702/
[2]http://paste.openstack.org/show/802703/'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-02-16 17:14:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-16 10:23:44.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

In case when security group is removed from port, connections
established to/from port which were hitting some of the removed SG
rules will be marked with CT_MARK_INVALID in the conntrack table.
Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will
not be revived.
To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked
with CT_MARK_INVALID and related to the port of which SG are
updated/added.

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd
'}, {'created': '2021-02-18 08:15:13.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

In case when security group is removed from port, connections
established to/from port which were hitting some of the removed SG
rules will be marked with CT_MARK_INVALID in the conntrack table.
Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will
not be revived.
To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked
with CT_MARK_INVALID and related to the port of which SG are
updated/added.

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

In case when security group is removed from port, connections
established to/from port which were hitting some of the removed SG
rules will be marked with CT_MARK_INVALID in the conntrack table.
Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will
not be revived.
To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked
with CT_MARK_INVALID and related to the port of which SG are
updated/added.

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd

commit_message:
Add IPv6 configuration options to Octavia management network

If the Octavia/Amphora management network is created by Kolla, support
setting the IP address family and IPv6 address/RA mode.

Closes-Bug: 1913409

Change-Id: I9f2ef2196654c91596cb5c4b3c157bcee267226a

commit_message:
Change the default agent_heartbeat_expiry to 90s

By default, trove guest agent is sending health heartbeat msg for every
60s, so agent_heartbeat_expiry should be bigger than that.

Change-Id: I348a82aa948079b7bba5c172b8d57d5f5dee28a0
(cherry picked from commit 5640a61acbfd3449ba700f495aa885f54fd2e080)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-10 21:32:37.000000000', 'message': 'vmware: Use cookiejar from oslo.vmware client directly

With changing the SOAP library backing oslo.vmware [1], the cookiejar of
a session must be accessed differently. Therefore, oslo.vmware
introduced a property on the client to abstract this change away. This
commit uses the new place to access the attribute.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: I8e3167debf9e378fe87c95974df2df94cf21bbd7
'}]
commit_message:
vmware: Use cookiejar from oslo.vmware client directly

With changing the SOAP library backing oslo.vmware [1], the cookiejar of
a session must be accessed differently. Therefore, oslo.vmware
introduced a property on the client to abstract this change away. This
commit uses the new place to access the attribute.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: I8e3167debf9e378fe87c95974df2df94cf21bbd7

commit_message:
Make content provider depend on tox-pep8/tht on check layout

As part of [1] - optimize the zuul layout so that content-provider
doesn't run if openstack-tox-pep8 and openstack-tox-tht are not
green.

These jobs are voting so they block us anyway, may as well
save running anything else if these small jobs aren't complete

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I5fca006e529809ace8d348735f1e10c57ef90e6b

commit_message:
Deprecate monasca-log-api

The Rest API for the log-pipeline in Monasca is merged into
monasca-api repository

Change-Id: I218da772afcd0f0da423eeeeaaed5a8896f9a678

commit_message:
Make content provider depend on openstack-tox-linters in check

As part of [1] - optimize the zuul layout so that content-provider
doesn't run if openstack-tox-linters is not green. Only applies
to the check queue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I658458c4cf4b66a8fca40a619bc18f511962b913

commit_message:
LVM: fix _create_vg

Call _create_vg instead of create_volume()
to create VGs.

This would break cases where the LVM code
is trying to create VGs on top of PVs.

Closes-Bug: #1915439
Change-Id: I4ada6f9c1bddcdfac61fcd9d3436ef37a7e104cc

I think this is a good change and we should merge it.

The reason for the -1 is that there's a patch up to enhance the Backup Restore API to allow specification of AZ and volume type in the request [0].  What I'd be in favor of is adding volume type specification to this patch, but keeping its under-the-hood use of the Volume Create API, so that it can be backported to earlier branches.

Then at some point after the new API is merged, the client code can be revised to use it without requiring any interface changes.

commit_message:
Support backup-restore to a specific volume type or AZ

Enhance the 'backup-restore' shell command to support restoring a
backup to a newly created volume of a specific volume type and/or in a
different AZ. New '--volume-type' and '--availability-zone' arguments
leverage the existing cinder API's ability to create a volume from a
backup, which was added in microversion v3.47.

The shell code is a new v3 implementation, and it drops support for the
v2 command's deprecated '--volume-id' argument.

Change-Id: Ic6645d3b973f8487903c5f57e936ba3b4b3bf005

Then I ran: 'tox -e venv validate-request' and the introduced test worked properly as sdist build phase reported the pbr version check error)"}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-02-19 17:26:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-17 14:31:15.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that we can build sdist from requested tags

Adding validation check to ensure that we are able to build sdist from
the latest tag.

This will allow us to detect sooner when we will try to add a tag to a branch
which is older than another tag already on that branch/in that branch's history

Indeed we recently experienced similar issue [1] with os-collect-config and
tripleo-ipsec where projects hadn't been branched for ussuri [2] and where
we tried to create a new ussuri release [3] on the same hash that an
existing wallaby tag.

Projects have been branched [3] after tags creation [2].

commit_message:
Ensure that we can build sdist from requested tags

Adding validation check to ensure that we are able to build sdist from
the latest tag.

This will allow us to detect sooner when we will try to add a tag to a branch
which is older than another tag already on that branch/in that branch's history

Indeed we recently experienced similar issue [1] with os-collect-config and
tripleo-ipsec where projects hadn't been branched for ussuri [2] and where
we tried to create a new ussuri release [3] on the same hash that an
existing wallaby tag.

Projects have been branched [3] after tags creation [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/020112.html
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/688914aa29745bd4f445670581f79760e731a5f2
[3] ihttps://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/772047

Change-Id: Ie2d055f171418e2d35db697dfb1aa17cd449bea9

commit_message:
Add test coverage for SCTP health checker script

Also removed a block of shell code in install-ubuntu.rst,
because the block triggered an error in the doc job and it was unused.

commit_message:
Use ansible to install client packages

This change deprecates the puppet process to install the openstack
service clients and transitions to the ansible role for installing
client packages.

Story: 2005984
Task: 34437

Conflicts:
  - deployment/clients/openstack-clients-baremetal-puppet.yaml
  - environments/standalone/standalone-overcloud.yaml
  - environments/standalone/standalone-tripleo.yaml

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1834161
Change-Id: I3ba4eb6e3352e117450fc0130de3e547df93fe84
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c0b1055b10de371f672b6900b7d3163815b12655)

commit_message:
Do not call --detach when using podman create

We should never use --detached when calling podman create as it
makes no sense and has actually been removed in podman 3 via
https://github.com/containers/podman/commit/15345ce4c3b02389fe172f090549a50b95322753

Any use of that flag when using podman >= 3.x create will error out with:

  Error: unknown flag: --detach

Change-Id: I8356110aba03dcbc09de97633bfe6f03580e2e7a
Closes-Bug: #1915500

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for metadef properties

This commit adds two new policies for metadef properties. This is part of a
broader series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC
experience and improve security.

Change-Id: Iec0bec71fcfd151108cfe5e62e5d3819628ac221

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for metadef objects

This commit adds two new policies for metadef objects. This is part of a
broader series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC
experience and improve security.

Change-Id: Idfa02701944a68078f5d81ac61be6a012c2a02ac

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for metadef namespaces

This commit adds two new policies for metadef namespaces. This is part of a
broader series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC
experience and improve security.

Change-Id: Iad0f81794e9c9158eada22240f2a1c6c5b511779

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

This allows to use lower-constraints file as more readable way
instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

https: //zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
Change-Id: I890048df63a600db1bcf97817f796975f02d72d3

commit_message:
Stop barbican servics in unupgraded controllers

This change makes barbican services on unupgrade controller nodes get
stopped, because all services in the unupgrade controllers should be
stopped before we start the upgraded controller[1].

[1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: I7031064b752450bacbb7775c0e357b98210a8929

commit_message:
Stop non-pcmk services of manila and cinder during upgrade

This change implements missing external_upgrade_tasks for non-pcmk
services of manila and cinder, to ensure that we don't have mixed
versions of controller services running at the same time during
upgrade.

These tasks should have been implemented in the initial patch[1], but
missed at that time unfortunately.

 [1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: I35ea4354a7448a23d6517f9777ed022caa79347a
(cherry picked from commit 60c22c38ccfd253dec3766ad58c4b16d3a74f467)

subject: Remove deprecated option show_multiple_locations
messages:
[{'account_id': 28752, 'date': '2021-02-19 14:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28752, 'date': '2021-02-19 14:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-02-19 15:27:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We can not drop this option because while it's deprecated, it functionality can't be worked around:
`You cannot work around this option via policy configuration at the present time, though that is the direction we believe the fix will take.`

Also ceph backend never contains credentials, and we enable it only for rbd backend. Also deployer can override it in user_variables.yml"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-02-19 15:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}]

Change-Id: Ie727d3a83b12388f36178d00eb5543f0733e077c

Change-Id: Ie727d3a83b12388f36178d00eb5543f0733e077c

commit_message:
Remove deprecated option show_multiple_locations

Revealing image locations can present a GRAVE SECURITY RISK as image locations can sometimes include credentials.
https://docs.openstack.org/glance/victoria/configuration/glance_api.html#DEFAULT.show_multiple_locations

Change-Id: Ie727d3a83b12388f36178d00eb5543f0733e077c

commit_message:
Cap bandit to v1.6.2

We don't have test requirements in upper-constraints, so we need
to cap it in stable branches manually to work with Python 2.7.

Change-Id: Ie597e778e3efa61bfd98eaaa92730b5050195e7a
(cherry picked from commit a512bfc233fc76c4375388b8546ab9e60459e1d3)

(cherry picked from commit 7abe6dc063eac6f40a3c4eacde41f222989c7a36)

[{'created': '2021-02-09 11:33:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix Windows support

With a single line change, we can use this cinder client extension
on Windows. This patch will avoid the os.getuid call, which is
unavailable on Windows.

Note that on Windows, we aren't doing any privilege escalation,
assuming that we already have the required rights.

Here's a sample: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/802466/

Change-Id: Ic554b5df2adee38b97665c578ca69b33c8694ca7
"}, {'created': '2021-02-19 15:06:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix Windows support

With a single line change, we can use this cinder client extension
on Windows. This patch will avoid the os.getuid call, which is
unavailable on Windows.

Note that on Windows, we aren't doing any privilege escalation,
assuming that we already have the required rights.

Here's a sample: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/802466/

Change-Id: Ic554b5df2adee38b97665c578ca69b33c8694ca7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Windows support

With a single line change, we can use this cinder client extension
on Windows. This patch will avoid the os.getuid call, which is
unavailable on Windows.

Note that on Windows, we aren't doing any privilege escalation,
assuming that we already have the required rights.

Here's a sample: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/802466/

Change-Id: Ic554b5df2adee38b97665c578ca69b33c8694ca7

commit_message:
cgname need to be passed instead of group to '_create_consistencygroup'.

Create consistency group from source group in XIV failed with
ILLEGAL_NAME error, as cgname is like to be passed , instead
group object passed before.

Change-Id: Ic21f2000c6dfca2dd906fbac2ecd8864ac41ebc0
Closes-Bug: #1866777

commit_message:
fix create volume backup failed when enable TLS

We create volume backup failed when we enable TLS.
The reason is that we can't set the swift endpoint type, and default is
PUBLIC endpoint type[1].
For more security, we should set the swift endpoint type is internal
when the OpenStack enable TLS.
So we should let the operator set the swift endpoint type.

[1]:https://github.com/openstack/python-swiftclient/blob/master/swiftclient/client.py#L623

Closes-Bug: #1888378

Change-Id: I71d4ac15b9410c75c026eb43cc21831bbf1a00a1

commit_message:
Use os-brick 4.2.0

Update requirements to use the wallaby intermediate brick release
containing the updated nvmeof connector and other bugfixes.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/775792

subject: Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml
messages:
[{'account_id': 31052, 'date': '2020-11-11 00:51:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28062, 'date': '2020-11-11 10:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Hi Yanos, thanks for your investigation and thanks for the fix.

At first glance it looks like we are using oslo-config [1] to handle the configuration like in the rest of Monasca modules. But you are right, monasca-agent is still using .yaml files instead of oslo-config .conf files.

The code in monasca_agent/collector/virt was derived from Ceilometer, and these are "loose ends".

Yanos, would you like to lead the migration to oslo-config?
It should be similar to this changes in Monasca-notification [2]

Of course we will help you if you decide to take the migration.


[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent/src/branch/master/monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py#L21

[2] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2000959'}, {'account_id': 26141, 'date': '2020-11-12 14:02:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 25277, 'date': '2020-12-15 14:57:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for this fix. Shouldn't it be cherry-picked to all the active/supported branches?"}, {'account_id': 33083, 'date': '2021-02-19 15:36:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Thanks for this fix. Shouldn't it be cherry-picked to all the active/supported branches?

+1"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-11 00:51:23.000000000', 'message': "Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml

The 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options are currently set by oslo configuration library.
However, in 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py' file these options cannot be
provided by a configuration file. Changing this to retrieve both options from
'conf.d/libvirt.yaml' file.

Change-Id: I1918fda471e951f42db0d302e371108b664e936c
"}]
commit_message:
Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml

The 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options are currently set by oslo configuration library.
However, in 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py' file these options cannot be
provided by a configuration file. Changing this to retrieve both options from
'conf.d/libvirt.yaml' file.

Change-Id: I1918fda471e951f42db0d302e371108b664e936c

commit_message:
NetApp E-Series: Allow static CHAP credentials

This patch makes it possible to save a static username/password pair
in the Cinder configuration file for use by the NetApp E-Series driver.
It allows avoiding reconnection and instance migration issues caused by
out-of-date passwords cached on the initiators.

Change-Id: I99916414f666fccb76b702f180b174b74c42a67e
Related-Bug: #1742977

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing (stable Ussuri)

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

As decided in Neutron meeting, stable branches will drop this
CI job [2].

Change some test requirements up-to-date.
Use sodium-latest instead of snapshot, as snapshot is no more available
on maven.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: I6911923fa68c8ea44cc3436901c9be8344ae21e3

[{'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-04-30 14:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-04-30 15:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

For what it's worth, in the Red Hat product, we use the /versions endpoint for this kind of thing. That being said, adding healthcheck is at worst harmless, at best useful, so I don't see why we shouldn't do it.

I also went (quickly) looking at how other projects do this, and found that keystone included a release note, a unit test, and admin documentation, so we should probably have those here too?

Or we could avoid all that complexity, and make /versions our "official" healthcheck endpoint, and document that.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-04-30 15:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build SUCCESSFUL (check pipeline).

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/724684/4 : FAILURE in 2h 32m 53s'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-04-30 23:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Artom Lifshitz, we can't have one URL per project, and just hope that operators will agree. That's the first thing.

2nd thing, the /versions isn't reacting the same way as the oslo.middleware healthcheck. It's replying with "HTTP/1.1 300 Multiple Choices" and some json, instead of "HTTP/1.1 200 OK" with no content. So it really isn't the same, and if we follow your advice, monitoring and haproxy have to handle a specific case for Nova, which is counter-productive from the operator point of view.

Melanie, I have opened such a debate on the list under the "Starting community-wide goals ideas for V series" thread. If you believe my proposal isn't a good idea, please voice your concern there.

Also, I'm an operator and the Debian package maintainer for OpenStack. I maintain 500+ packages, plus an OpenStack installer that I wrote on my own, plus the production clouds that I maintain (5 of them). My time to work on each individual project is very limited. If you want to add a bunch of tests, please feel free, that'd be the best thing forward. However, if you intend to make writing tests a condition for this patch to be approved, without contributing them, then I'll keep this patch as a Debian specific thing, and I will give up on sharing it, because I simply don't have the time available to write it.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-04-30 23:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Artom Lifshitz, we can't have one URL per project, and just hope
 > that operators will agree. That's the first thing.
 > 
 > 2nd thing, the /versions isn't reacting the same way as the
 > oslo.middleware healthcheck. It's replying with "HTTP/1.1 300
 > Multiple Choices" and some json, instead of "HTTP/1.1 200 OK" with
 > no content. So it really isn't the same, and if we follow your
 > advice, monitoring and haproxy have to handle a specific case for
 > Nova, which is counter-productive from the operator point of view.

Those are definitely good arguments in favor of a unified OpenStack-wide /healthcheck endpoint.

 > Also, I'm an operator and the Debian package maintainer for
 > OpenStack. I maintain 500+ packages, plus an OpenStack installer
 > that I wrote on my own, plus the production clouds that I maintain
 > (5 of them). My time to work on each individual project is very
 > limited. If you want to add a bunch of tests, please feel free,
 > that'd be the best thing forward. However, if you intend to make
 > writing tests a condition for this patch to be approved, without
 > contributing them, then I'll keep this patch as a Debian specific
 > thing, and I will give up on sharing it, because I simply don't
 > have the time available to write it.

Yeah dude, I know who you are, and we're all busy and have things to do :) Tests and documentation have always been a requirement where appropriate/necessary (though for something simple like this I can understand skipping tests - still, for completeness and extra confidence I personally would like to have one). If as an operator you don't have the bandwidth to work on this, that's fine, but please present it as such, and one of us will be happy to take it on, especially if it becomes a community goal.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-04-30 23:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

I like the idea and in favour of doing it. It will be easy for load balancer or any users to check actual status of nova before interacting. 

I am worried if the default backend is enough here or not. That will only check the API endpoint is reachable or not + file existence if enabled. How about other parts like nova API is running but cannot reach out to any of the compute service or database at least. At least if API service is running and cannot reach to DB for any reason then we should not return pass. interacting at least one compute service availability can be more strict checking. 

Another point is that this endpoint is unauthenticated so do we want to enable it by default? The current code proposal will enable it by default. Should be add a config option to enable it?  or a policy (this might not be easy but need to check how policy can be enforced on running middleware)

All these things to discuss or get consensus, should we try to add spec first with all those details and then discuss in PTG if needed. My -1 for having a spec to discuss all those points.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-05-05 19:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > I know gmann and dansmith have concerns/ideas around making this
 > more complete (for instance reporting DB and MQ status for all cell
 > as well as the API services) and authentication, but as the saying
 > goes, perfect is the enemy of good, and I think the simple
 > healthcheck proposed here is a worthwhile-enough win to go forward.
 > 
 > I think for completeness docs would be nice, see inline.
 > 
 > I guess my worry would be that this might lock us into something we
 > regret - so if we ever get around to adding a "deep status"
 > healthcheck, we'd have to do it at a different endpoint.

Yes, this. I don't know enough about the healthcheck middleware plugin API to know whether we could easily add an auth'ed /healthcheck endpoint. Does anyone know? My thinking is that if we, at a minimum, expose it with authentication, we could add more to the healthcheck down the road like checking basic DB and MQ health. As was discussed in #openstack-nova around this recently, having [only] nova-api respond is a fairly limited definition of health for nova, where the DB and/or MQ being down would mean you have a major problem yet the /healthcheck is still saying things are "healthy".

If I understand correctly, the canned version of this healthcheck middleware seeks only to provide an extremely basic, unauth'ed "I'm alive" ping location. However, I want to point out that coincidentally, we've just gotten that ability recently with a change that made version discovery possible without auth [1]. So, if that's all we want, it seems we already have it. Just point load balancers at the base nova url '/'.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/685181
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-all-major-versions'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-05-07 00:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/724684/11 : FAILURE in 2h 26m 03s'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-05-07 01:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> If I understand correctly, the canned version of this healthcheck
 > middleware seeks only to provide an extremely basic, unauth'ed "I'm
 > alive" ping location. However, I want to point out that
 > coincidentally, we've just gotten that ability recently with a
 > change that made version discovery possible without auth [1]. So,
 > if that's all we want, it seems we already have it. Just point load
 > balancers at the base nova url '/'.

Yeah - but I also understand Thomas' argument that operators don't want to have one healthcheck URL per service - for instance keystone with /healthcheck, nova with /, cinder with a third thing, etc.

Could we maybe settle on having /healthcheck capable of handling authentication, but for now return the simple "the HTTP service is alive" is both cases, authenticated and not? And then later, add the "deep status" healthcheck as a response for when the client authenticates correctly?'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-07 14:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Melanie,

Typically, you'd setup Haproxy to do a test every second on /healthcheck. At least, that's what I've done in production.

It'd be nice to add db connectivity check, conductor check, and so on, but none can be resource intensive, or take too much time, otherwise, it's not going to work for a check by HAProxy.

I'm not sure if everyone understand how a typical HA setup is done, so let me remind what's going on.

The goal here, is for (typically 3 deployments of) HAproxy to check for all API servers available (typically, 3 OpenStack "controllers"). Then the OpenStack VIP, moving from one API machine to the next in case of failure, points to one or the other HAProxy instance that is installed in the cluster.

So the /healthcheck test is really to check if there's connectivity and if HAproxy can connect to the API web server. If it can't, HAProxy will try to use one of the other API web server that is in the deployment. It'd be nice to check if there's DB connectivity, but chances are that if one of the API servers can't connect to the DB, probably the other can't either. Indeed, in a normal setup, the DB is also reachable only through the VIP (not through localhost, otherwise there is a risk of MySQL split brain case...).

So yeah, by all means, do add some more tests, but keeping in mind that it *must* be respond very quickly, and not cannot be resource intensive (as in: a connection to the DB to check if it's there, I consider this as too expensive...).'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-05-07 17:33:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-2

We talked about this in the nova meeting today and continued discussion in the nova channel. We had consensus that we would want to be able to extend the /healthcheck later to actually do things to check health of nova.

So before merging this, we need to do some basic due diligence to determine whether we would be able to use this middleware to access (for example) a cache of health data built in the background during normal auth'ed requests to the API. gmann said he would be able to look into this next week [1]. Based on what he finds, we aim to be able to know whether we can use the oslo middleware for our health check or if we need to expose it some other way to allow it to be extendable.

Adding a procedural -2 while that investigation takes place.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2020-05-07.log.html#t2020-05-07T17:10:17"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-26 18:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-10-07 09:32:45.000000000', 'content': "Restored

Let's try to discuss this again"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-10-07 09:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-10-07 10:27:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

any news ?'}]

commit_message:
Add a /healthcheck URL

This is useful for operators to configure HAProxy and
for monitoring.

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie735336d143ad38dc10bb8200f9d3b713e603503

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs_spec_helper to < 3.0.0 on train

Some centos-7 jobs [1] are now failing with:
centos-7 | The `minitar` executable is no longer bundled with `minitar`. If you are
centos-7 | expecting this executable, make sure you also install `minitar-cli`.
centos-7 | rake aborted!
centos-7 | SyntaxError: /home/zuul/workspace/.bundled_gems/gems/puppetlabs_spec_helper-3.0.0/lib/puppetlabs_spec_helper/rake_tasks.rb:152: syntax error, unexpected ':', expecting =>
centos-7 | ...voke(force: true, 'target-dir': File.join(Dir.pwd, 'pkg'))
centos-7 | ...

Since they are pulling in a recent puppetlabs_spec_helper which is
likely not compatible with the ruby version in centos-7:
centos-7 | Installing puppetlabs_spec_helper 3.0.0

Let's pin it to < 3.0.0

Closes-Bug: #1916125

[1] https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_3c8/776424/1/check/puppet-openstack-unit-5.5-centos-7/3c82a14/job-output.txt

Change-Id: I4bea96767a3246054c5d98271d8378d84fefc247

commit_message:
Add Python3 wallaby unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for wallaby.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Idfbbf97c60b6487eba1c4848b1225531f37759aa

commit_message:
Implement fake_constants when generating UUIDs

Dynamically generating UUIDs in unit tests is
generally discouraged because it makes it hard
to write elastic recheck queries for unit test
failures.

Change-Id: I798a5638ab13d1e24d91d6f2c95946632d15f7c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 07:41:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix encryption_key_id bug in backup-restore

Restored_key_id is taken from backup's "volume base metadata". It's backup
source volume's encryption_key_id. If we use it as backup‘s encryption_key_id,
when deleting the backup, the key will also be deleted. This will cause the
backup source volume to be unavailable. So we should clone restored_key_id as
backup's encryption_key_id to ensure that the backup's encryption_key_id is unique.

Change-Id: Id67e7edb681784ea02b06e02b9aa2f72cc6dbdae
'}]
commit_message:
Fix encryption_key_id bug in backup-restore

Restored_key_id is taken from backup's "volume base metadata". It's backup
source volume's encryption_key_id. If we use it as backup‘s encryption_key_id,
when deleting the backup, the key will also be deleted. This will cause the
backup source volume to be unavailable. So we should clone restored_key_id as
backup's encryption_key_id to ensure that the backup's encryption_key_id is unique.

Change-Id: Id67e7edb681784ea02b06e02b9aa2f72cc6dbdae

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing (stable Victoria)

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

As decided in Neutron meeting, stable branches will drop this
CI job [2].

Change some test requirements up-to-date.
Use sodium-latest instead of snapshot, as snapshot is no more available
on maven.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: I6911923fa68c8ea44cc3436901c9be8344ae21e3

subject: Modify find to use -H to support symbolic links
messages:
[{'account_id': 32432, 'date': '2021-01-29 15:39:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32432, 'date': '2021-01-29 16:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2021-02-01 07:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-02-04 07:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2021-02-04 15:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Just adding the "-H" option to find should be enough to get this fixed. From the man:

       -H     Do  not  follow symbolic links, except while processing the com‐
              mand line arguments.  When find examines or  prints  information
              ...

WDYT?'}, {'account_id': 32432, 'date': '2021-02-17 19:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2021-02-17 19:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2021-02-18 12:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-02-19 10:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

damn... the definition of that -H switch is written in reverse -.-. Basically: "resolve symlinks whenever it's possible".'}]

commit_message:
Modify find to use -H to support symbolic links

Use -H switch on find command to follow symbolic links for
find command line arguments.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I60c8703e06fb8e399dce0f009e434d0cc3731e64

[{'created': '2020-11-10 14:09:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the tripleo job definition

This patch redefines the puppet-octavia-tripleo-standalone job based on
tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-standalone, to fix the tripleo
standalone job currently broken.
The difference between puppet-octavia-tripleo-standalone and
tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-standalone is that we use
tripleo-puppet-ci-centos-8-standalone as its base job so that we can
make all tripleo jobs in puppet projects non-voting in a single place.

Change-Id: I4b1ded4d16d84e9324462c405eb9ecddd907ae1b
(cherry picked from commit d0bec1c8121b835116f70dff7d7ed9dea31a09f1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the tripleo job definition

This patch redefines the puppet-octavia-tripleo-standalone job based on
tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-standalone, to fix the tripleo
standalone job currently broken.
The difference between puppet-octavia-tripleo-standalone and
tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-standalone is that we use
tripleo-puppet-ci-centos-8-standalone as its base job so that we can
make all tripleo jobs in puppet projects non-voting in a single place.

Change-Id: I4b1ded4d16d84e9324462c405eb9ecddd907ae1b
(cherry picked from commit d0bec1c8121b835116f70dff7d7ed9dea31a09f1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-12 10:43:49.000000000', 'message': "[L3HA] Bind metadata haproxy to IPv6 address if IPv6 is enabled

Patch [1] added possibility that haproxy spawned as metadata proxy in
the router's namespace can be bound to IPv6 address.
We misssed to add the same for the HA router, so when router was
switched to be active on the node, L3 agent starts haproxy for that
router but it was always bound to IPv4 address only.
That patch fixes it by adding check if IPv6 is enabled on host, and if
yes, it adds same config to the haproxy like it is in non-ha mode.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/715483

Closes-Bug: #1915495
Change-Id: Ie97cfe9fe0020929d9a1736d55ad92a5bd643072
"}, {'created': '2021-02-18 07:55:51.000000000', 'message': "[L3HA] Bind metadata haproxy to IPv6 address if IPv6 is enabled

Patch [1] added possibility that haproxy spawned as metadata proxy in
the router's namespace can be bound to IPv6 address.
We misssed to add the same for the HA router, so when router was
switched to be active on the node, L3 agent starts haproxy for that
router but it was always bound to IPv4 address only.
That patch fixes it by adding check if IPv6 is enabled on host, and if

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/715483

Closes-Bug: #1915495
Change-Id: Ie97cfe9fe0020929d9a1736d55ad92a5bd643072
"}]
commit_message:
[L3HA] Bind metadata haproxy to IPv6 address if IPv6 is enabled

Patch [1] added possibility that haproxy spawned as metadata proxy in
the router's namespace can be bound to IPv6 address.
We misssed to add the same for the HA router, so when router was
switched to be active on the node, L3 agent starts haproxy for that
router but it was always bound to IPv4 address only.
That patch fixes it by adding check if IPv6 is enabled on host, and if
yes, it adds same config to the haproxy like it is in non-ha mode.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/715483

Closes-Bug: #1915495
Change-Id: Ie97cfe9fe0020929d9a1736d55ad92a5bd643072

[{'created': '2021-02-18 08:00:07.000000000', 'message': "Trigger deploy guide rebuild on a-r-r update

In deploy guide we rely on latest_tag to provide users with valid git tag
in the guide. However this is broken now, since deploy guide rebuild
is not triggered by jobs.

This change makes use of long ago added project-template that
also triggers build on a-r-r update comparing to it's original [1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/commit/9f64b09a4b9dee2c5adcde696b59c689237c5d7a/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L1628-L1649

commit_message:
Trigger deploy guide rebuild on a-r-r update

In deploy guide we rely on latest_tag to provide users with valid git tag
in the guide. However this is broken now, since deploy guide rebuild
is not triggered by jobs.

This change makes use of long ago added project-template that
also triggers build on a-r-r update comparing to it's original [1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/commit/9f64b09a4b9dee2c5adcde696b59c689237c5d7a/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L1628-L1649

Change-Id: I4708b2ad183b4c09582f723d6c114012c8a6ea17
(cherry picked from commit 98a10bca4bf1159ac062c32e213e4bb04b0d85ea)

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: If1e3daaf88d51241d4dfdcbbb19025efa28c00d2

commit_message:
Make neutron-tempest-dvr-ha-multinode-full to be 2 nodes job

It was run on 3 nodes but I think there is no real need for that.
Running that on 2 nodes should be enough.

Change-Id: I12406c1f654ba9ad8eb60ffc965293ecbd5b7be5

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-04 10:37:01.000000000', 'message': "Move tempest job with neutron-lib master to the experimental queue

The job neutron-tempest-with-neutron-lib-master is mostly to check if
current neutron changes will work fine with some changes done in
neutron-lib.
It isn't really needed to run it on all patches and can be rune on
demand by running experimental queue if that is needed.

This patch also removes job neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-master from the
experimental queue as we already have there similar multinode job.
As job neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-master wasn't used anywhere, this patch
also removes its definition.

Finally this patch improves ci_scenario_jobs document and adds there
info about experimental queue and what is there currently.

Change-Id: I0fc4ffd5db2673cefcd01307555d1a3900bb12e8
"}]
commit_message:
Move tempest job with neutron-lib master to the experimental queue

The job neutron-tempest-with-neutron-lib-master is mostly to check if
current neutron changes will work fine with some changes done in
neutron-lib.
It isn't really needed to run it on all patches and can be rune on
demand by running experimental queue if that is needed.

This patch also removes job neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-master from the
experimental queue as we already have there similar multinode job.
As job neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-master wasn't used anywhere, this patch
also removes its definition.

Finally this patch improves ci_scenario_jobs document and adds there
info about experimental queue and what is there currently.

Change-Id: I0fc4ffd5db2673cefcd01307555d1a3900bb12e8

'}, {'created': '2021-02-11 12:48:02.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Fix for UEFI

Change-Id: Iddeae2727bcb9350acb75ae0a8306c5e87147cf2
'}, {'created': '2021-02-11 13:05:27.000000000', 'message': '[train-only] Add FFWD workaround for UEFI systems

Due to old bug in how Ironic was deploying nodes the UEFI based
deployments have very wrong setup.
1) The nodes were installed via grub-install command which
   assembles grub binary instead of providing the signed one.
   It also creates efi recod with only "red" in it like:
   /File(\EFI\red\grubx64.efi)
2) The partition hosting /boot/efi was never added to fstab
   resulting in this partition never being mounted even if it was
   used to boot the system. There were no updates done to the
   binaries and no configuration.

This patch tries to check for this specific setup and if it's the
case we create fstab record, mount the partition, reinstall the
grub2-efi and shim to create proper filesystem structure on it,
create proper boot record pointing to \redhat\ and write grub.cfg
for it.

Resolves: rhbz#1925078

Change-Id: Iddeae2727bcb9350acb75ae0a8306c5e87147cf2
'}, {'created': '2021-02-12 10:24:58.000000000', 'message': '[train-only] Add FFWD workaround for UEFI systems

2) The partition hosting /boot/efi was never added to fstab

   binaries and no configuration.

This patch tries to check for this specific setup and if it's the
case we create fstab record, mount the partition, reinstall the
grub2-efi and shim to create proper filesystem structure on it,
create proper boot record pointing to \redhat\ and write grub.cfg
for it.

Resolves: rhbz#1925078

Change-Id: Iddeae2727bcb9350acb75ae0a8306c5e87147cf2

This patch tries to check for this specific setup and if it's the
case we create fstab record, mount the partition, copy the original
filesystem structure on it, create proper boot record pointing to

Resolves: rhbz#1925078

'}, {'created': '2021-02-15 14:45:48.000000000', 'message': '[train-only] Add FFWD workaround for UEFI systems

Due to old bug in how Ironic was deploying nodes the UEFI based
deployments have very wrong setup.
1) The nodes were installed via grub-install command which
   assembles grub binary instead of providing the signed one.
   It also creates efi recod with only "red" in it like:
   /File(\EFI\red\grubx64.efi)
2) The partition hosting /boot/efi was never added to fstab
   resulting in this partition never being mounted even if it was
   used to boot the system. There were no updates done to the
   binaries and no configuration.

This patch tries to check for this specific setup and if it's the
case we create fstab record, mount the partition, copy the original
filesystem structure on it, create proper boot record pointing to
\redhat\ and write grub.cfg
for it.

Resolves: rhbz#1925078

Change-Id: Iddeae2727bcb9350acb75ae0a8306c5e87147cf2

commit_message:
[train-only] Add FFWD workaround for UEFI systems

Due to old bug in how Ironic was deploying nodes the UEFI based
deployments have very wrong setup.
1) The nodes were installed via grub-install command which
   assembles grub binary instead of providing the signed one.
   It also creates efi recod with only "red" in it like:
   /File(\EFI\red\grubx64.efi)
2) The partition hosting /boot/efi was never added to fstab
   resulting in this partition never being mounted even if it was
   used to boot the system. There were no updates done to the
   binaries and no configuration.

This patch tries to check for this specific setup and if it's the
case we create fstab record, mount the partition, copy the original
filesystem structure on it, create proper boot record pointing to
\redhat\ and write grub.cfg for it.

Resolves: rhbz#1925078

Change-Id: Iddeae2727bcb9350acb75ae0a8306c5e87147cf2

commit_message:
tools: Allow check-cherry-picks.sh to be disabled by an env var

The checks performed by this script aren't always useful to downstream
consumers of the repo so allow them to disable the script without having
to make changes to tox.ini.

NOTE(lyarwood): This backport has
Ie8a672fd21184c810bfe9c0e3a49582189bf2111 squashed into it to ensure the
introduced env var is passed into the pep8 tox env.

tox: Add passenv DISABLE_CHERRY_PICK_CHECK to pep8

I4f551dc4b57905cab8aa005c5680223ad1b57639 introduced the environment
variable to disable the check-cherry-pick.sh script but forgot to allow
it to be passed into the pep8 tox env.

Change-Id: I4f551dc4b57905cab8aa005c5680223ad1b57639
(cherry picked from commit 610396f8ad5fe8c3abb7731fcd42c81e5246a938)
(cherry picked from commit 3d86df068a7a78f8faa9ac6437ff4fc19f5cebcc)
(cherry picked from commit cb96119e59df64d6884431c8f2e8f6ced8318bd7)

commit_message:
Updates to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3

* Update requirements.txt to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3
* Update tox.ini to change the build parameters.
* This upgrades from <2.7 which adds reproducible charms
* Bug was fixed that controlled the default output directory
  doesn't get 'builds' appended.  The tox change puts it
  back so that stable & master both build to the same
  directory.  This may be reviewed in the future.

Change-Id: If175d58b7b663927d7e7be1c44550a9b8aaa5d79

commit_message:
Fix functional jobs

Use a focal node instead of Fedora for barbican-dogtag-tox-functional
as that seems to be more stable and the job on fedora is currently
broken anyway.

Set the correct devstack service for the KMIP and Vault functional
jobs.

Change-Id: Iaff7ca28681a812606eeee743e4038d6d609eab0

commit_message:
Bump default mariadb version to 10.4

Mariadb 10.4 has been stable for more than a year, we should be able
to use it by now.

Change-Id: I6219336f6de1da91908b8e166af255f80054ffed

commit_message:
Set default swap size back to 8G

We changed the default from 8G to 1G earlier[0], but that seems to cause
issues with some jobs, see e.g. [1] and [2]. So revert to 8G, this
doesn't seem to be as costly as we expected anyway.

[0] I5ce9064a5546d85ab6f41c4e60aa56fa56ff47c1
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752187/2/roles/prepare-node/tasks/main.yaml
[2] https://review.opendev.org/757488

Change-Id: I32fbc024230f01662eaded0e46f5c87619d17366

commit_message:
[OVN] ovn-metadata-agent: Retry registering Chassis at startup

This patch adds a retry mechanism on the register_metadata_agent()
method from the OVN metadata agent to make it more tolerable to the
start up order of the services.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/ovn/metadata/agent.py

Change-Id: If0e5a64e5f692c781fb5e6a68b948b611c694ab0
Closes-Bug: #1905700
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9c236db3bf18854aef5a29a37dd83bff8bda2f7d)

commit_message:
Updates to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3

* Update requirements.txt to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3
* Update tox.ini to change the build parameters.
* This upgrades from <2.7 which adds reproducible charms
* Bug was fixed that controlled the default output directory
  doesn't get 'builds' appended.  The tox change puts it
  back so that stable & master both build to the same
  directory.  This may be reviewed in the future.

Change-Id: I856f3cd72d424772b1d29d4a3f5f6c61c1708f68

Do not do run-time configuration of SR-IOV or hardware adaption
for hardware offload. In addition to being detrimental to any
virtual machine instance consuming the VF this will break NIC

complicated to get right. For example if you are using bonding
and hardware offload the virtual functions and hardware specific
setup has to happen _BEFORE_ netplan applies network configuration
to the system.

Change-Id: Id0b81848658a3bd34470440bd68928ae9f6682e4
"}, {'created': '2021-02-16 10:46:15.000000000', 'message': "SR-IOV: match on PCI address, don't do runtime config

for hardware offload. In addition to being detrimental to any
virtual machine instance consuming the VF this will break NIC
firmware in some configurations.

The task is delegated to the installed packages and their systemd
services and configuration will occur at system bootup time.

We may consider adding an action to perform the configuration at
run-time if the operator really wants to, but it is very
complicated to get right. For example if you are using bonding
and hardware offload the virtual functions and hardware specific

Closes-Bug: #1908351
Change-Id: Id0b81848658a3bd34470440bd68928ae9f6682e4
"}]
commit_message:
SR-IOV: match on PCI address, don't do runtime config

Replace in-charm SR-IOV code with the common ``SRIOVContext``

Do not do run-time configuration of SR-IOV or hardware adaption
for hardware offload. In addition to being detrimental to any
virtual machine instance consuming the VF this will break NIC
firmware in some configurations.

The task is delegated to the installed packages and their systemd
services and configuration will occur at system bootup time.

We may consider adding an action to perform the configuration at
run-time if the operator really wants to, but it is very
complicated to get right. For example if you are using bonding
and hardware offload the virtual functions and hardware specific
setup has to happen _BEFORE_ netplan applies network configuration
to the system.

Closes-Bug: #1908351
Change-Id: Id0b81848658a3bd34470440bd68928ae9f6682e4

commit_message:
Remove remains of historic SR-IOV support

The change in I7a3ddf91d4b2ae6aa0806d97c45b59e8a951f67f replaced
the historic SR-IOV support with tooling from the networking-tools
PPA.

Remove the now orphaned template files and references to them in
the code.

Related-Bug: #1908351
Change-Id: Ic22b3dc8a5dd7ec3358571d9725ccc9e3dad64f4

commit_message:
Add Redfish RAID management to Ironic

The Redfish hardware type does not currently implement the RAID
hardware interface.

This patch implements the Redfish RAID interface, allowing operators
to specify the desired RAID configuration on Ironic Redfish nodes.

Change-Id: Icf5ca865e0c1e168b96659229df622698bea1503
Story: 2003514
Task: 24789

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/sushy/+/774532
Change-Id: I19a0d095a68c061975b28b668d86afad19a37ca1

series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and
improve security.

subject: WIP - make heat-pod compatible with SELinux
messages:
[{'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-02-17 14:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-02-18 02:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

i still have an SELinux issue testing with this with podman 2. Should we just be targetting podman 3 exclusively at this point?

[root@master-uc ~]# rpm -q podman
podman-2.0.5-5.module_el8.3.0+512+b3b58dca.x86_64

The AVC is for reading heat.conf:

type=AVC msg=audit(1613613598.274:2563): avc:  denied  { read } for  pid=75261 comm="heat-engine" name="heat.conf" dev="vda1" ino=33584059 scontext=system_u:system_r:container_t:s0:c110,c185 tcontext=system_u:object_r:container_file_t:s0:c24,c242 tclass=file permissive=0
type=AVC msg=audit(1613613598.479:2564): avc:  denied  { read } for  pid=75286 comm="heat-api" name="heat.conf" dev="vda1" ino=33584059 scontext=system_u:system_r:container_t:s0:c110,c185 tcontext=system_u:object_r:container_file_t:s0:c24,c242 tclass=file permissive=0


audit2allow seems to suggest:

#       Possible cause is the source level (s0:c132,c557) and target level (s0:c201,c218) are different.
allow container_t container_file_t:file read;


surely I have that already?

However, the hostNetwork change does work! so we can get rid of that.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-02-18 07:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> type=AVC msg=audit(1613613598.274:2563): avc:  denied  { read } for  pid=75261 comm="heat-engine" name="heat.conf" dev="vda1" ino=33584059 scontext=system_u:system_r:container_t:s0:c110,c185 tcontext=system_u:object_r:container_file_t:s0:c24,c242 tclass=file permissive=0
> type=AVC msg=audit(1613613598.479:2564): avc:  denied  { read } for  pid=75286 comm="heat-api" name="heat.conf" dev="vda1" ino=33584059 scontext=system_u:system_r:container_t:s0:c110,c185 tcontext=system_u:object_r:container_file_t:s0:c24,c242 tclass=file permissive=0

so here, it's because of the MCS - the "lower" level of SELinux. Basically, the heat.conf file is "locked" by one container - that's why the ":z" is handy when bind-mounting things within multiple containers.

This *might* be due to the way the file is generated from within another container that isn't part of the pod.

For instance, if we inspect the two running container within the pod, we can see they have the exact same SELinux context - this allows to "cross-mount" things.
The current patch should have switched all of the ":Z" to ":z" in heat_launcher.py, so that the SELinux level is set to "s0" instead of "s0:cXX,cYY" - this "s0" level should allow the needed accesses.

My guess: let's target podman-3, especially since it will be out soon, and we can expect to have, at least, podman-3 for Wallaby/osp-17 (might even be a newer one).

> 
> 
> audit2allow seems to suggest:
> 
> #       Possible cause is the source level (s0:c132,c557) and target level (s0:c201,c218) are different.
> allow container_t container_file_t:file read;
> 
> 
> surely I have that already?

yeah. the issue is due to the MCS here 😊

> 
> However, the hostNetwork change does work! so we can get rid of that.
\o/ though podman-2 does it wrong, if you run "iptables -vnL -t nat", and check the last ruleset, you'll see that *everything* directed on port 8006 on *any* of the host IP will be redirected to the container. This might cause a security threat. Podman-3 does it right, as per https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/9395#issuecomment-779928931'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-02-19 09:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

changes have been integrated in its parent.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-17 14:46:33.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - make heat-pod compatible with SELinux

This patch also drops the need of "hostNetwork: true" in the pod
definition.

Tested on podman-3 (due for rhel-8.4). On podman-2, there's an isolation
issue with the DNAT rule.

Note: hard-coded IP should be changed in favor of a template thing
pointing to the ctlplane IP, or maybe localhost (127.0.0.1).

Change-Id: Ie738f83e36537a1642abb43a3eb883dd210c1d31
'}]
commit_message:
WIP - make heat-pod compatible with SELinux

This patch also drops the need of "hostNetwork: true" in the pod
definition.

Tested on podman-3 (due for rhel-8.4). On podman-2, there's an isolation
issue with the DNAT rule.

Note: hard-coded IP should be changed in favor of a template thing
pointing to the ctlplane IP, or maybe localhost (127.0.0.1).

Change-Id: Ie738f83e36537a1642abb43a3eb883dd210c1d31

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 01:14:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove NestedQuotaDriver

NestedQuotaDriver was marked as deprecated in Train release and

commit_message:
Remove NestedQuotaDriver

NestedQuotaDriver was marked as deprecated in Train release and
was expect to be removed in Ussuri.
This patch removes the same in Wallaby release.

Change-Id: Ide2d53caf1bc5e3ba49f34b2f48de31abaf655d0

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc and tests.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I207c02ba71fe60635fd3406c9c9364c11f259bae

commit_message:
Fix gate requirement checks job

Current requirements-check job is failing with
below error:

ERROR: Requirement for package PrettyTable excludes a version not excluded in the global list.
  Local settings : {'<0.8'}
  Global settings: set()
  Unexpected     : set()
Validating test-requirements.txt

Keeping PrettyTable same as what we have in openstack/requirements repo

Change-Id: I63633d2932757ca23bcea69fd655a2499a5b6d31

commit_message:
Add shared file systems support

Introduce the shared file systems storage
service proxy, and add a basic service
resource to list availability zones.

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/ashrod98-openstacksdk-manila-support/us/11?kanban-status=2360120

Depends-On: Ia2e62d3a11a08adeb6d488b7c9b365f7ff2be3c8
Change-Id: I20f1f713583c53a2df7fd01af11234960c9c8291
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

subject: [Train Only] Move resource default statements above other calls
messages:
[{'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-02-18 14:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-18 15:51:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Did something change in puppet? My understanding was that this was applied at catalog build time which means the order shouldn't affect it."}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-02-18 15:58:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
> 
> Did something change in puppet? My understanding was that this was applied at catalog build time which means the order shouldn't affect it.

From what i read is resource defaults are dynamically applied https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/5.5/lang_defaults.html#behavior, i see same behavior in both puppet 5 and puppet 6, didn't checked older releases."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-18 16:04:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ah maybe i'm confusing it with the ordering which can be anywhere.  It's been a while. It makes sense that it'll change things going forward in the file processing rather than being retroactive"}, {'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2021-02-18 16:43:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I tested locally on CentOS Stream 8 and it works.
Though I don't understand why it's working in CentOS 8
but not in Stream without this patch."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-18 19:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh yea we could probably also do the following which would work retroactively

Concat <||> { selinux_ignore_defaults => true }
File <||> { selinux_ignore_defaults => true }'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-02-19 05:00:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
> 
> I tested locally on CentOS Stream 8 and it works.
> Though I don't understand why it's working in CentOS 8
> but not in Stream without this patch.

It's because of latest selinux-policy rpm in stream-8, with next centos8 release i.e 8.4 it will be seen there too. Some more context in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/+/769962."}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-02-19 07:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Oh yea we could probably also do the following which would work retroactively
> 
> Concat <||> { selinux_ignore_defaults => true }
> File <||> { selinux_ignore_defaults => true }

Yeap it works too, Thanks for sharing.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-02-19 08:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-18 14:16:39.000000000', 'message': '[Train Only] Move resource default statements above other calls

These defaults need to be moved before any other "include"
calls.

This is Train Only as in ussuri+ releases there is not
any "include" call before it.

Change-Id: Ia4c3431fb002cf58f8b5494b53903380e6fcb9c9
'}]
commit_message:
[Train Only] Move resource default statements above other calls

These defaults need to be moved before any other "include"
calls.

This is Train Only as in ussuri+ releases there is not
any "include" call before it.

Change-Id: Ia4c3431fb002cf58f8b5494b53903380e6fcb9c9
